Post by: Elula on April 15, 2012, 08:47 pm
Glade, Relentless Nass, Global Gathering, Creamfields and Bestival.

Could do with some tips on sneaking in drugs, Creamfields is the one I want to be really cautious at. Currently debating buying a multi-pack of crisps, opening them up, taking them all out and then putting everything into the packet at the bottom and then re-sealing it with an iron. Then just placing all the crisps back in and sealing up the multi-pack with the iron again. My only worry about doing this is that if i was searched and/or a sniffer dog found something it's be totally out of my control. Atleast if I had it down my boxer/briefs there's still i chance I could pop it up there worst case scenario

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: wowzers on April 16, 2012, 12:48 pm
Quote from: Elula on April 15, 2012, 08:47 pm
Glade, Relentless Nass, Global Gathering, Creamfields and Bestival.

I went to Glade for the first few years but stopped due to crime & security. Be careful about security- the organisers started hiring some really horrible bastards. They clearly don't have a clue about festival security- they act more like a paramilitary. I saw a standard dreads-and-muesli hippie having his wrists cable tied and a knee in the back of his neck because security saw him skinning up  :o
I've been robbed there, my ex had 80 quid stolen from her sleeping bag when she was in it,  most of my friends have also had their tents gone over on at least one occasion.

Nass was fun when I was in my early teens, used to get very out of hand though- lots of pissed skater kids setting fire to things  ;D

I wouldn't mind going to Bestival but every year it seems to clash with at least 5 other big events so I've never got round to going.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: wowzers on April 16, 2012, 12:56 pm
Oh and for those of you who couldn't get tomorrowland tickets- consider Dance Valley in NL, it's only a 1-dayer but similar lineup.
Dour in Belgium is also good, bit more varied musically.

For people who like Croatian festivals but are dubstepped out & don't fancy Outlook, look at the Garden festival in Tisno- unbelievable lineup  :D

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: AJAPAI on April 16, 2012, 07:32 pm
Has anyone or is anyone going to outlook? i wanna go but since im from the u.s and have never been im just wondering will ghb be easily available? i know molly will be im not too worried about that but i cant go anywhere without my g lol. and idk if i could smuggle it to creotia.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: wowzers on April 16, 2012, 08:09 pm
Yeh I've been to Outlook. Croatia has very tough drug laws but as with most European countries they tend to turn a blind eye to discreet personal drug use. You'll be okay on the festival site but don't take the piss, especially off-site. I'd be suprised if you could get GHB there.

Not implying you're that sort of person but contrary to the assumptions of a lot of US gap year students that I've met in the Balkans, Croatia isn't a third world country and you can't get out of legal tight spots by chucking a small amount of Kuna at the police...
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: AJAPAI on April 16, 2012, 10:47 pm
yea thanks wowzers i have been talking to other people about it and they been saying the same thing that creotia has tough drug laws and i wouldnt be able to find ghb there because not alot of people want to risk it. but fuck i just cant roll and stuff without g so outlook might have to wait on my list of festivals haha.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: gg on April 22, 2012, 11:03 am
I am definitely going to Wakarusa this year, and possibly Harvest if I have the funds.

Anyone who can make it to Wakarusa should check out Easter Island next year. It's small, but the tickets are super cheap. There's also Backwoods Bash nearby which is located in a beautiful park near a lake.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on April 22, 2012, 08:21 pm
Quote from: gg on April 22, 2012, 11:03 am
I am definitely going to Wakarusa this year, and possibly Harvest if I have the funds.

Anyone who can make it to Wakarusa should check out Easter Island next year. It's small, but the tickets are super cheap. There's also Backwoods Bash nearby which is located in a beautiful park near a lake.

Don't forget about Byrdfest, i used to go to Schwagstock back at Camp Zoe in Missouri, but that got shut down and they moved over to Ozark Arkansas, I've haven't been to the new place in AR but i've been meaning to check it out

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Elula. on April 24, 2012, 08:03 pm
Quote from: wowzers on April 16, 2012, 12:48 pm
Quote from: Elula on April 15, 2012, 08:47 pm
Glade, Relentless Nass, Global Gathering, Creamfields and Bestival.

I went to Glade for the first few years but stopped due to crime & security. Be careful about security- the organisers started hiring some really horrible bastards. They clearly don't have a clue about festival security- they act more like a paramilitary. I saw a standard dreads-and-muesli hippie having his wrists cable tied and a knee in the back of his neck because security saw him skinning up  :o
I've been robbed there, my ex had 80 quid stolen from her sleeping bag when she was in it,  most of my friends have also had their tents gone over on at least one occasion.

Nass was fun when I was in my early teens, used to get very out of hand though- lots of pissed skater kids setting fire to things  ;D

I wouldn't mind going to Bestival but every year it seems to clash with at least 5 other big events so I've never got round to going.

Thanks for the heads up, was planning on meeting up with some friends I've lost contact with at Glade and was only really going to go there for the atmosphere. Going by what you said I think I'll give it  miss, I don't really know anyone on the lineup (excluding the few DnB/Dubstep producers) so I can't see it being worth going whatsoever.

I've not hit 20 yet so going to Nass is still a laugh, it gets out of hand but it's normally the majority of the crowd so it's never really dangerous.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on April 24, 2012, 09:47 pm

STS9 and Pretty Lights at Red Rocks. Waka should be awesome, last year was hot as fuck so we got a camper this year. String cheese is playing like 3 sets at electric forest I think. I am so pumped for festival season!!!! I just placed my first round of SR orders today, couple different bags of molly and some dmt. I had bought a test kit this year and was going to rely on that for festivals but after finding SR I figured I would just stock up and not bother with the whole drug scene at the shows.

Yeah, i found some good molly last year for a good price, but it definitely wasn't Dutch crystal.
I can't wait to see Bob Weir and Primus and Waka
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: InTransit on April 25, 2012, 01:04 am
Well this is my first post outside of the welcome forum. Finally joined last week on 420 and how fitting. Now lets get on with festivals.

This years Festivals i have on my list right now is EDC Vegas, Electric Forest, at least two ID Festivals,  Electric Zoo and maybe a couple others thrown in there as well and i am hoping i don't miss Holy Ship again. Also hoping sensation will announce there U.S. dates soon.

Now about my experience with past festivals in the U.S.

Last year i did ultra, electric forest, and 3 Identity festivals.

Okay the vibes i have notice over the last five years East coast, Mid West/Central, West Coast

East Coast- I have never been a fan of the east coast vibes. I feel like it has way to many meat heads involved and it is a lot more of a Bro kind of thing. People are very disrespectful weather it is a show or a festival. If you bump into someone they are more about saying fuck you why did you do that. There are friendly people but most of the people there are manly there for just for the drugs. Now don't get me wrong i love my drugs but it is more then just the drugs to me i love the music i love the social interactions and i love the experience that the event has via piro, lights, stages, and rides if any. Also from my experience i have notice a lot more bunk ass drugs all over the east coast at festivals. I have had many first timers ask me questions when they find out i sell and it is scary the things they take not knowing what they are getting so i am always happy to educate others when in the field.

Mid West/Central- A lot more laid back then the east coast. Always pretty good vibes from all event goers. A lot of good bud but it is hard to find a lot of good drugs by the time they hit there they are pretty stomped on so you might be getting something that at one time was good but it normally has to go through so many hands to get to these areas it normally isn't that good. Festivals though are a good place to come across good stuff. A lot more people here are looking to have good times. So many good small and large festivals through out the Midwest that i don't think get enough recognition.

West Coast- God west coast is like a melting pot of everything. So many good vibes though and good people. Always been a good drugs and they are always pretty easy to get your hands on when at festivals. The EMD scene has been around for ever so there are a lot more ravers and plur kids on the west coast. Also i think a lot more time and planning go into festivals on the west coast and they real strive to give you that all around amazing time at a festival.

Ultra is awesome if you can get past the east coast vibe. Be very careful if you sell at here. They bust a lot of people her and when they do they give you options on whether you want to go to jail or be a nark. They also have a lot of actual narks that are out in the crowds. You can normally spot them pretty easily. One of my biggest bitches about ultra is there water situation. They never have any place to fill up at. Getting drugs in can be pretty easy if you are smart about it. they do a pretty good job at pat downs and going through your belongings.

Electric Forest- Probably the best festival I have ever been to so this review is going to be very long. If there is one festival that you have to go to this is it. The campground are amazing and so many good vibes, you can get your hands on anything there and you can bet it will be very pure. If you are selling do all of your selling in the campgrounds. Last year i didn't hear or see anyone getting busted on the campgrounds. Now in the festival that is a different story besides weed, weed is legal in Michigan and as long as you have the proper documentation they don't care that you smoke. If you don't have your papers find someone that does and smoke with them. I meet a grower last year that kept smoking me out and any time the cops walked by just handed it off. About the COPS they are very friendly and if you are fine with them they are fine with you don't' act suspense and they wont bother you. I spent a lot of time rolling balls and tripping shooting the shit with the cops in the forest and talking about the festival. They are there for your safety and not once did i ever see them abusing there power. There are a lot of cops so just be wary. Now the festival ground are amazing. It is just a long on going place. There isn't any sound that bleeds over from the other stages because they are so spread out and there are woods between all of them. They have put a lot of time and money into this place and it is rented out by a very awesome family and it is there land so be very respectful of the land. In the forest there are all kinds of art sculptures and tripy lights for your enjoyment along with hundreds of hammocks provided by the festival but people do bring there own as well. I am sure if any of you are there i will see you there because i will be selling MDMA from Germany, Kitty powder(hopefully be able to get my hands on pharmaceutical grade liquid still capped but i haven't talked to my seller in a while now), will have ganja treats, boomers, and LSD and probably NO for friends. Now back to the festival The weather last year was perfect besides the first night we had a gnarly lightning storm that delayed the festival. Waking up it is nice and there is always a nice breeze so make sure to bring warmers clothes for the night time and plenty of blankets. WOW i have gone on but i guess i could still go on about how amazing this festival is. There is a good vibe here and good music for all sort of different tastes in music.

Bonnarro- Awesome festival and awesome vibes from everyone. They always put on a good festival. Now this is more of a one and done festival for me. WAY WAY WAY TO FUCKING HOT in the summer. It is almost impossible to even try and sleep because it is so warm. A lot of good drugs and a lot of good drugs. Make sure to stay hydrated because it gets so fucking hot in the covered stages. A lot of cool are installations to look at.

EDC- I have not been to Vegas yet so i will have to report back but from what i have heard i hear it was a good move for EDC to leave LA. It used to be a bitch to try and go to different stages because it was such a cluster fuck and fuck trying to get out of the Colosseum or even getting in. Lot of good drugs went around when in LA. There was a lot of narks and cops but as long as you are stupid about it you would be fine. SO MANY FUCKING HOT GIRLS. if you want skimpy clothes and chill people looking to have a good time and listen to amazing EDM music this is the festival for you. Hands down the BEST EDM festival in the country. Insomniac knows how to put on a fucking show. They know what they are doing and they have been doing it for over 10+ years now. All kinds of amazing art installations, there stages are amazing and they put a lot of money into them. All kinds of fun rides for when you want to take a break from the music. Also they proved free wanted that you can refill you Insomniac water bottle with(now that is awesome nothing is more important then the water). They always bring in the best EMD artist ever-year. Can't wait to go to this years and this will be my first time in Vegas so it is going to be a damn good time.

My fingers are going but there is a few reviews on some U.S. festivals. But much love and respect. Be smart and you will stay out of jail and always have respect for others there.
Title: Re: Festivals!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on April 25, 2012, 04:39 am
Quote from: mollysbf on April 25, 2012, 04:33 am
Quote from: Mrambulancedriver on April 24, 2012, 09:47 pm
Quote from: mollysbf on April 24, 2012, 09:08 pm
Quote from: Mrambulancedriver on April 18, 2012, 06:59 pm
Quote from: mollysbf on April 18, 2012, 04:54 am
Wakarusa, Electric Forest, and a few weekends of Red Rocks! Waka was amazing last year and I am pumped to trip at Electric Forest

See you at Waka brother! What shows you hitting at Red Rocks? I got a few buddies who are probably gonna check out the Further shows. I would loove to go to String Cheese but I'm going to see The Wall in Denver in a couple weeks, then Waka, a small festival, and All Good, so i'm pretty packed for now

STS9 and Pretty Lights at Red Rocks. Waka should be awesome, last year was hot as fuck so we got a camper this year. String cheese is playing like 3 sets at electric forest I think. I am so pumped for festival season!!!! I just placed my first round of SR orders today, couple different bags of molly and some dmt. I had bought a test kit this year and was going to rely on that for festivals but after finding SR I figured I would just stock up and not bother with the whole drug scene at the shows.

Yeah, i found some good molly last year for a good price, but it definitely wasn't Dutch crystal.
I can't wait to see Bob Weir and Primus and Waka
They will both be awesome and pretty lights will be good for rolling there. I got ripped last year on just about everything. Of all things I got that was legit was DMT, same dude sold me bunk acid but makes me think it might have been the humidity that ruined it since the dmt was dank. My stats on molly were 1/3. All I can say to everyone is TAKE ADVANTAGE OF BUNK PD if you haven't. They will be at most festivals this year and will test your stuff for free. They usually have a booth.

Can you link me to some info about this Bunk PD?? I would love to apart of something like that! Is it legal to test people's drugs at a festival in America??
I would totally bring my test kit and test stuff for people!!

All I can say to everyone is TAKE ADVANTAGE OF BUNK PD if you haven't. They will be at most festivals this year and will test your stuff for free. They usually have a booth.

Can you link me to some info about this Bunk PD?? I would love to apart of something like that! Is it legal to test people's drugs at a festival in America??
I would totally bring my test kit and test stuff for people!!

Just look into it on google. I looked into working/volunteering for them at festivals this year but decided against it because I would rather enjoy drugs myself and test them for friends and neighbors. The owner told me that they don't handle the drugs, sounded like they hand you a platter to hold and tell you to drop a sample on there then they drop the reagant so they never actually handle the drug. He said that they have had, overall, good reactions from local LE that understand they are doing harm reduction. They have been around for 2 or 3 years I think.

Yeah i googled it, I'm looking into and it seems awesome. I got my test kit off of Dancesafe.org and I know they do similar things. I'm gonna send em an email and see what i can do. I've been interested in that kind of thing, especially in my area.
Going to raves in town its crazy seeing how many people are uninformed about the drugs they think they're taking...
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: zubic09 on April 25, 2012, 05:04 am
^I've seen that as well, which is why I try to avoid buying anything at events. On a contradictory note the best molly I have ever had I picked up from a random dude at bisco but yeah test kits are a must when buying from random people at festivals.

He said that they have had, overall, good reactions from local LE that understand they are doing harm reduction. They have been around for 2 or 3 years I think.

Yeah i googled it, I'm looking into and it seems awesome. I got my test kit off of Dancesafe.org and I know they do similar things. I'm gonna send em an email and see what i can do. I've been interested in that kind of thing, especially in my area.
Going to raves in town its crazy seeing how many people are uninformed about the drugs they think they're taking...
yeah it's sad really. I stood by the bunk pd booth last year at waka for like a whole afternoon and I would say that 85% of the drugs if not more where not what the user thought they were. 90% of those times the users had no idea that there were such drugs as things like mephedrone and shit, they would find out they don't have coke, molly, or lsd and assume it was just bunk. Then they find out it's 25i or methylone or dimethocaine and they are just flabbergasted. I saw a lot of people act like they were never going to do drugs again after finding out the shit they were taking.
I saw a ton of people that thought they had the best molly at the fest and found out they had straight amphetamine and rc's

Where was that booth at?? I definitely woulda been hanging out there had i known about it. That sucks tho! My friends brought some blotter from town that ended up being DOx, but they didn't want to believe me when i told them..Guess who ended up being the only one sleeping that weekend?

But i got some Mushroom chocolates that were solid, and my buddy had some 2c-b that was alright, i traded it for some molly that i bought there, so it probably wasn't too good haha

I've been thinking about bringing my test kit to festivals..
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: mollysbf on April 25, 2012, 05:12 am
bringing your test kit is so worth it. You almost don't have to bring it, just say you have one when a dealer comes up, if they say they are ok if you test it that usually means they are at least confident in their product. Not saying that means it's good though cuz like I said, especially with molly, I have met TONS of people that think their shits good and it is a total mixed bag of rc's. The stand last year was only up for a day and a half, friday night and all day saturday if I remember right, in the merch area of campgrounds. I agree with zubic on the fact of the best molly I ever had was from some shady dude at a small show but I have also had some terrible nights and probably really hurt my brain from some of the shit people have sold me. If your going to waka or forest and need any super potent 2c's just mention my name and i'll hook you up.
Title: Re: Festivals!

At Waka,Keep an eye for a guy wearing a brown flatbill with dancing bears around the back, he'll be happy to trade some blonde kief blocks for some good 2c-b

Title: Re: Festivals!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: mollysbf on April 26, 2012, 05:06 pm
Quote from: delsol88red on April 26, 2012, 06:32 am
RE:Generation a Honring's Hidedout!!!!! 

I went to regen last year and it was AWESOME, overall great experience, drugs, people etc.

I also went to waka last year and I had a great time but got a really shitty bag of molly and a bunk 10 strip of L

I really have a strong suspicion that a lot of drugs at waka last year were originally probably ok and after spending all day in that 100 degree heat with 85% humidity in a hippies pocket they might have fallen victim to mother nature. Well the acid at least.....there's bunk molly everywhere anymore from my experience. The main reason I think that is because the same dude that sold me bunk acid sold me some dmt, I didn't even try it for months because I assumed it was bunk and it looked like crumbled pringles in a gel cap. Man was I wrong! That stuff was amazing. Re:generation looks amazing though! Not many bands but they are the cream of the crop.

Title: Re: Festivals!

Really excited for regen this year though!  3 sets of STS9 and 2 Umphreys sets + Big G= EPIC!  Can't wait to see them all play together as I assume they will.  Really hope they add Beats Antique to the line up again.

See you at Re:gen  8)  I'll most likely be waving a Colorado flag  8)

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: zubic09 on May 01, 2012, 10:54 pm
This looks like a fun smaller event in northern VA if anyone is around that area

http://www.facebook.com/events/149497315172538/

We give you THREE massive stages of sound ranging from house to dubstep and everything in between.

We will be having a festy version of Phamily Phun Day, full of games, challenges, events & of course, music. We will be having team competitions so bring or meet a group of friends & register your team for the many events including

Scavenger Hunt
Tug-O-War
Sack Race
Flag Football
Glow Flag Football
Giant Slip & Slide
Flashlight Tag
Relay Race ( involving balloon between the legs, egg, wheel barrel, ect. )
Frisbee Golf Day/Night
Capture the flag
Tire Race
Water Balloon Toss
Water Sponge Relay
Simon Says
50 Foot Long Tag Wall ( to leave your mark ( Spray Paint Provided ) )


There will be one of the hottest light and laser setups in the area with enough sound to keep the trees shaking for days to come.

P.L.U.R. & R.O.A.R. in FULL EFFECT!!

This is a Phamily style event so PLEASE KEEP THE DRAMA W YOUR MOMMA. Have P.L.U.R., meet some new people and enjoy one great summer weekend.

18+ w/ Valid Government Issued ID ( No exceptions )

You will be asked to sign a waiver form before you enter. Signing this form will show that you acknowledge that participation in the 2012 Camp Glow Campout Presented by Dirty Dubz Entertainment, 7-17, Va's Finest & Crave Rva Productions may carry some risk of injury & that you knowingly assume all risks, whether known or unknown, during participation in this event.

**No John Hancock, No Entry**

B.Y.O.B. ( for those of you who are old enough, of course )
As well as your tents, sleeping bags, pillows, teddy, food &/or anything that you feel you will need!

Broken glass hurts hippie/raver feet so NO GLASS! ( bottles that is ^_- )

NO TANKS!! Cars will be searched FOR TANKS upon entrance & if they are found they will be confiscated AND disposed of... This mean you WILL NOT get it back, EVER, so don't risk it!

$5 off w/ non perishable or canned food ( Tuna & Peanut Butter get you extra BROWNIE POINTS)

**** All donations will go to The Central Virginia Food Bank under the name P.L.U.R. ****

***** We would like it to be a donation so large that it ends up in the paper & possibly makes not only an impact on the many in Central Va who are hungry but that others will see it & strive to help the less fortunate as well! *****

Gates will be closed from 2am - 8am
*** This means, for your safety, no entry & no exit between these times. Unless of course an emergency. ***

If your interest in being part of this event, whether it be stages, vending, performing, help with field day like events or just lending a helping hand where needed, please email dirtydubz@ymail.com.

~* Workshops *~
Kandi Making Groups
How to Poi, Glove & Sphere
Dancing/Liquid
Face Painting

Lineup:

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: toker420 on May 07, 2012, 09:55 am
Quote from: Raven1318 on May 06, 2012, 02:44 am
Anyone have advice for selling at festivals? I've sold a few joints before to people who have asked, but I've never brought large amounts of anything to a festival or really tried to sell before.

Have yourself or a close friend take some of whatever you're selling.   Chances are it won't be long until people know they are having a great time and they will want what he's on.  Do not go in there yelling shrooms, LSD, MDMA, get it while it's hot.  The feds are everywhere these days and it's not that hard to get caught up if you're not careful.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: idypha on May 13, 2012, 06:53 am
Quote from: Raven1318 on May 06, 2012, 02:44 am
Anyone have advice for selling at festivals? I've sold a few joints before to people who have asked, but I've never brought large amounts of anything to a festival or really tried to sell before.

I'd also be interested in some advice, having never attended a festival myself. Planning on going to as many as I can this Summer.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DSiddious on May 13, 2012, 09:21 pm
Quote from: idypha on May 13, 2012, 06:53 am
Quote from: Raven1318 on May 06, 2012, 02:44 am
Anyone have advice for selling at festivals? I've sold a few joints before to people who have asked, but I've never brought large amounts of anything to a festival or really tried to sell before.

I'd also be interested in some advice, having never attended a festival myself. Planning on going to as many as I can this Summer.

If your going there JUST for the purpose of selling then hang around entrances to places (tents, car-parks, toilets etc etc.) This is where most people go to buy. Look out for security if your just selling a few ten bags they arnt gonna be to bothered there looking for the people shifting major weight.
If you are going to sell at a festival then be on your toes BIG TIME don't smoke, sniff anything you need to be alert. But if your going there just to have fun then just go with the flow, take it case by case. But remember to Look out for yourself! there are ALOT of bad people who go to festivals.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: redalloverthelandguyhere on May 14, 2012, 12:30 am
Anyone reading these forums already has an alternative to being ripped off at festivals by the myriad of rats who basically live off the happiness of others - knowing many will have their guard down,

I hate festival thieves. I know in my area there are some who travel to festivals basically to steal. For this reason - don't bring anything expensive. No need for designer clothes and expensive jewellry. Be aware that every scammer in a 100 mile radius will like head to a good festival just to rip people off.

Best tactic is to buy what you need well in advance. For the average festival my main stash is hash. I avoid bud as its so obvious and can be smelt by an undercover cop in the next county!

I think MDMA is a must have. why risk getting some god awful rubbish when MDMA here is priced at most around 4 per 100mg.

Speed also has its moments. Very few moments actually as the pay back for speed is the main reason most will not use!

A bit of cocaine for a festival - well, wjo would not say no to quality beak? Finding it is another thing. But if you have access or have found a good dealer here then coke would be the ideal drug to take so as to save redosing on MDMA.

Mushrooms - I like to collect the UK natural harvest of our infamous shrooms. Every autumn I try to collect a little supply. Having dried shrooms ready to make a pot of tea fo friends is another night entertainment, Great for the 2.00am come downs - classic festival drug that is made better when you have trusted friends with you..

you can always eat some hash also. Its great! Eat 1 gram you at a certain level =- eat two its better - three grams of good hash is not far off tripping but mind and actually longer. Everyone ought to eat hash at least once.

I never deal at festivals but often have enough stash to help out a fellow festival goer.

I like to dance with women - my women knows this and its all just the spirit of the thing.

I cannot wait for the festivals to start.

 :)
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DSiddious on May 14, 2012, 12:45 am
One tip for everyone going to festivals, Don't put your valuables at the bottom of your sleeping bag. People go in your tent at night and cut out the bottom. I've seen this happen! 
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on May 14, 2012, 02:32 am
I haven't many drugs at shows, but i've bought a few times.

When i do sell, i strike up a conversation with someone, after knowing their not LE or a shady dude i'll offer whatever I'm selling.

If someone comes up to me asking i'll say "my friend might have some extra" and strike up a conversation, after confirming their not LE or a shady dude ill tell em ill be right back and then i come back an sell em whatever.

I try to make it seem like I'M not the dealer, i try to make it seem like i have a little extra, or 'my friend back at camp' has a little extra. I'm just worried if their LE or working with LE i dont want them to think I'm involved in some kind of operation.

Plus it feels good when you know your good drugs are going to good people. I met a guy last night looking for molly, he was a really cool dude, knew his stuff about the various analogues sold as 'molly', so it felt good to hook up a cool guy with some awesome MDMA who will know the difference between good stuff and bad stuff and appreciate it.


This is just my personal view on it, I'm not experienced in selling drugs at shows.
Title: Re: Festivals!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DivineMomentsofTruth on May 18, 2012, 07:27 pm
Quote from: Mrambulancedriver on May 14, 2012, 02:32 am
I haven't many drugs at shows, but i've bought a few times.

When i do sell, i strike up a conversation with someone, after knowing their not LE or a shady dude i'll offer whatever I'm selling.

If someone comes up to me asking i'll say "my friend might have some extra" and strike up a conversation, after confirming their not LE or a shady dude ill tell em ill be right back and then i come back an sell em whatever.

I try to make it seem like I'M not the dealer, i try to make it seem like i have a little extra, or 'my friend back at camp' has a little extra. I'm just worried if their LE or working with LE i dont want them to think I'm involved in some kind of operation.

Plus it feels good when you know your good drugs are going to good people. I met a guy last night looking for molly, he was a really cool dude, knew his stuff about the various analogues sold as 'molly', so it felt good to hook up a cool guy with some awesome MDMA who will know the difference between good stuff and bad stuff and appreciate it.


This is just my personal view on it, I'm not experienced in selling drugs at shows.

What he said :)
Be careful and feel people out before you sell anything to them..also this advice comes from personal experience, don't eat a bunch of L while you have a couple vials on you...you'll start thinking everyone is LE haha even the girl you sold a couple hits to a few hours ago
Title: Re: Festivals!

Be safe everyone.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: mollysbf on May 26, 2012, 04:27 pm
So I am heading for waka but got a quick question. If I were to be selling 2ci and 2ce while I am there should I focus on weighing out only individual capsules or do you think there will be people interested in .5g and gram bags? Ill be selling all hits for 5 bucks
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on May 26, 2012, 05:27 pm
Quote from: mollysbf on May 26, 2012, 04:27 pm
So I am heading for waka but got a quick question. If I were to be selling 2ci and 2ce while I am there should I focus on weighing out only individual capsules or do you think there will be people interested in .5g and gram bags? Ill be selling all hits for 5 bucks

I would do individual caps. I've never done it, but aren't 2ci and 2ce doses down in the milligrams? like 10-30mg something like that??
I highly doubt many people, especially simple buyers, have mg scales.

If someone wants .5 or a gram, just sell 'em it capped out. I'm sure they won't mind. Hell, whenever i sell a gram or two of MDMA already capped out most people thank me.


Oh and I'll be looking for you there! I might be tempted into buying some 2ci, unless your up to trade some for kief!
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DivineMomentsofTruth on May 26, 2012, 05:55 pm
+1
In the interest of harm reduction cap the 2cs up. Some stupid kid would take finger dips of it get spun out and lose everything...including whats left in the gram bag you sold him...which im sure some other kid will ground score and take a few finger dips of...this could continue, who knows maybe all weekend, well i think you get my point. Id be safe and cap them up no ones going to have a scale that can acurately weigh mgs.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: shman on May 29, 2012, 04:31 pm
Anyone know what to expect at security at electric forest? bringing personal amounts of weed, molly, etc Can you bring your own booze?
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: slybootz on May 29, 2012, 09:28 pm
Quote from: shman on May 29, 2012, 04:31 pm
Anyone know what to expect at security at electric forest? bringing personal amounts of weed, molly, etc Can you bring your own booze?

It's not TOO bad, it all depends on who you get when you arrive at the gates.  They do have you step out of your car, but they don't go through things extremely in-depth.  Put your shit in the bottom of your sleeping bag and put your sleeping bag at the bottom of all of your camping supplies and chances are they won't even touch it.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: shman on May 29, 2012, 11:53 pm
Quote from: slybootz on May 29, 2012, 09:28 pm
It's not TOO bad, it all depends on who you get when you arrive at the gates.  They do have you step out of your car, but they don't go through things extremely in-depth.  Put your shit in the bottom of your sleeping bag and put your sleeping bag at the bottom of all of your camping supplies and chances are they won't even touch it.

good to know
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Freeman on May 30, 2012, 03:12 am
Depending on how big your stash is you can also use a "can safe" that looks like a soda can and is weighted to feel full.  Buy a 12-pack or case of the same type of soda, remove one and insert your stash can at the back of the pack.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: pennyloaferz on June 01, 2012, 03:02 am
Quote from: Freeman on May 30, 2012, 03:12 am
Depending on how big your stash is you can also use a "can safe" that looks like a soda can and is weighted to feel full.  Buy a 12-pack or case of the same type of soda, remove one and insert your stash can at the back of the pack.

I do this at nearly every festival I go to- I used to have a Arizona Iced Tea Can- and I would throw that in a cooler along with like 4 others- no one has ever batted an eye and it held a considerable amount- I unfortunately lost that beauty and now have a can of Canada Dry 12oz- holds half the amount, which is only an issue for pipes and bud- things like rolls or tabs thats the perfect amount- you can even leave it in your cup holder, altho buying a 12 pack gives a little more ease.

Anyhow anyone going to Catskills Chill or Mint Fest
they look like 2 pretty good little fests at the end of the summer up in the northeast

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: slybootz on June 02, 2012, 05:55 pm
I've found some really clean L at rothbury each year I've gone ('08, '09, and EFF last year). 

Security's about the same as any other festival, you only get caught if you're being stupid.  Don't sell to undercovers: Look at the shoes!  Undercovers always have some clean ass shoes...lol

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: slybootz on June 03, 2012, 10:05 pm
Quote from: awesome1126 on June 02, 2012, 09:21 pm
I love how Electric Forest is by far the most popular one being discussed here, I'll be there too....with some of PF's stuff. Looks like EVERYONE at electric forest is gonna be rolling HARD :)

Also, anyone have any specific tips for vending at festivals? Shakedown street or tent hopping? Night or day? Selling inside the stage/concert area? Avoiding undercover LE?

IMO tent hopping is safer, and gets the same results as shakedown street.  Plus, while tent hopping, your happy customers often give you free beer/food after a sale!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on June 04, 2012, 07:30 pm

I didn't go to Scamp, but i hooked up my buddies with a few g's of Pfand's stuff before they left. One of my buddies came back and gave me a hug and said that shit made his weekend.

I went to Wakarusa this weekend and brought a couple extra grams of Pfand's molly. A few people weren't interested cus it was really white and crushed pretty fine, but i assured them it tested flawlessly on a Marquis and Mecke's.

The people that did buy some said that shit blew their minds during Pretty Lights.


I've yet to eat some of Pfand's mdma, as i have just a little bit of Skyy's stuff left, and that stuff is fucking top notch. I've heard nothing but great things from Pfand's stuff though so i'm looking forward to eating some in a couple weeks
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: mollysbf on June 04, 2012, 08:49 pm
Randomly ran into another SR member at the satellite stage at Wakarusa.....whats up man??? I'm sure your prolly to sketched out since we met in person because as soon as I turned around to continue our convo you were walking away. Can't say I blame you though, I had a feeling as soon as I heard you talk about what you had that we shopped at the same place. I gotta say I took one and a half of SKYYs stars and they felt like they were opiate based rolls or something because while I felt awesome all I wanted to do was sit down and feel the bass on the ground, exact same thing that used to happen back when I could get opiate based rolls on the regular IRL. I really enjoyed rockers mdma and so did all my friends. After one night in my pocket though it looks like dmt or something, rather than being pink it is kind of turning tan, brown, red? I think I am going to start sticking with a strict mix of 80mg mda 80mg mdma and then dipping out of a mix from there because the night I mixed them was fucking amazing....a haven't danced that hard in a long long time.

Title: Re: Festivals!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: zubic09 on June 07, 2012, 10:47 am
Quote from: awesome1126 on June 06, 2012, 09:59 pm
Quote from: zubic09 on June 06, 2012, 09:56 pm
^have fun at starscape man, I had a great time last year! 8)

Thanks man! Any tips on how to carry/bring in/vend safely?

yeah, I didn't think security was that bad, we had girls bring most of our stuff in. You should honestly be fine as long as you hide shit decently well. My friend managed to bring in like 100 or so prerolled joints in the lining of his backpack. For vending be careful during the day, but as soon as it got dark security back off a lot. PM me if you have any specific questions 8)

Z

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: slybootz on June 07, 2012, 12:43 pm
Quote from: zubic09 on June 07, 2012, 10:47 am
Quote from: awesome1126 on June 06, 2012, 09:59 pm
Quote from: zubic09 on June 06, 2012, 09:56 pm
^have fun at starscape man, I had a great time last year! 8)

Thanks man! Any tips on how to carry/bring in/vend safely?

yeah, I didn't think security was that bad, we had girls bring most of our stuff in. You should honestly be fine as long as you hide shit decently well. My friend managed to bring in like 100 or so prerolled joints in the lining of his backpack. For vending be careful during the day, but as soon as it got dark security back off a lot. PM me if you have any specific questions 8)

Z
Definitely true words about vending at any festival.  Also, tent hopping is typically much safer than shouting out your wares on shakedown street.  I would always get more customers tent hopping, plus there are the grateful buyers that will toss you free smokes/food/beer/etc.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: slybootz on June 11, 2012, 11:19 pm
there was some very clean white on white unperf'd paper going around summercamp this year, knew I should have picked up a sheet instead of just a few 10strips to split among my fellow camp-mates.  Ate just one on hit friday as a tester(had to eyeball the 10strip with a pair of scissors, was tasteless--a good first sign), could tell after 2 hours it was quite clean.  Ate 3 for shpongle on sunday, tripped my balls off.  Will be looking out for this crew at EFF
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: caffeine_me on June 13, 2012, 12:07 am
EDC, Vegas was truly a roller coaster of highs and lows.  First night was pretty damn good, although the area is so large and disorientating I often didn't know where I was or who I was listening too.  Sky's MDMA may have played a roll in that...fucking amazing.

Second night, started with walking by security with a tiny little piece of white paper (Thanks! Del Ellis) in my mouth.  Right when I entered, Josh Wink was playing an insane set that brought me back to when I saw him 14 years ago.The set of the year for me was Bassnector.  I have difficulty putting it into words, but I felt the music as much as I heard it.  The vibe was excellent at Kinetic (Largest area) stage, I decided to stay for Calvin Harris.  I was not very familiar with him, but he blew me away.  During his set is where it can be described being right at the point of climax and your mom walks in.  The music stopped and mass confusion started with reports of part of the stage falling and hitting Calvin, due to high winds.  I was looking forward to Avicii, Tiesto, Blueman with Aoki so we stuck around for about an hour, which you can imagine how the rest of the evening went with 100,000k people all wanting to leave at the same time.

Third night was an outstanding way to finish the festival.  My crew were getting the hang of staying together without the assistance of cell phones (The don't work with that many people around).  Chase and Status scared me away right starting off with rap, but my friends that stayed said it was an outstanding set.  I rolled (Thanks Sky) over to ATB and stayed until David Guetta started.  Overall, ATB took a little to long for me to get going.  Guetta was very good, lots of familiar tracks, but most with a stupendous twist.  Armin van Buuren stole the night with a hard hitting, dance your ass off (My favorite) set.  Porter Robinson also had a very good set, which kept me there the whole time.  Avicii went after Guetta, but was only a half hour.  That half hour was absolutely amazing, which seems like it would be hard to pull off what he did in 30 minutes.  I definitely will be seeing him on the flip side.

Overall, I give EDC/Insomniac 5/5 for managing the largest crowd of party goers I have ever seen in my life.  It sucked Saturday with the shut down, but the wind is not their fault and I am glad they put the safety of staff and crowd first.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: slybootz on June 14, 2012, 12:50 am
Finally got home from work and checked the Electric Forest artist schedule!

A few things from a quick look:

EOTO thursday!

2.5 hour tribe set on Friday!!!

When I first heard that Bassnectar and sts9 were at the same time, I was pissed.  But 2.5 hours of tribe on friday makes up for it.  plus, tribe plays from 12am-230am on saturday and bassnectar plays from 1230am-2am; so it'd would be possible to see the start of tribe at sherwood court, head to the ranch for bassnectar, and then head back to sherwood for the end of tribe.  Doesn't sound as bad as I initially imagined!

Papadosio > a bit of keller > DJ Solo early evening on sunday.  girl talk then to big gigantic for the closer on sunday night!

And I didn't even mention the hours upon hours of SCI sets!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: awesome1126 on June 19, 2012, 12:34 pm
9 days to EFF!

I'll ask again, any more tips & tricks for vending at festivals? Thinking things like MDMA, doses, etc..
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: stolea2269 on June 19, 2012, 01:50 pm
Quote from: awesome1126 on June 19, 2012, 12:34 pm
9 days to EFF!

I'll ask again, any more tips & tricks for vending at festivals? Thinking things like MDMA, doses, etc..

My wristband got here yesterday :) Lol, silly me tried it on... I didn't realize that you can only adjust it one way. I'm gonna be rocking this band for the next week or so :D
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: slybootz on June 19, 2012, 02:22 pm
Quote from: awesome1126 on June 19, 2012, 12:34 pm
9 days to EFF!

I'll ask again, any more tips & tricks for vending at festivals? Thinking things like MDMA, doses, etc..
Goddamnit I can't wait to get back into the Sherwood Forest!

Tips: don't sell to undercovers! Lol.... LE are looking for people moving larger amounts of product, so don't be too eager to offload all your gear on Thursday or Friday.  IMO tent-hopping is much much safer than shouting your wares on shakedown street. 

Biggest thing I can suggest is to be careful when driving into and out I town. Local cops have a field day because they know almost everyone is holding.  Drive under the speed limit, obey all traffic signals/signs.  Especially in Michigan, they have some funky left turn lanes, so be aware.  If you DO get pulled over, know your rights.

If you're going there just to vend, try and get rid of everything before you leave, so you're not riding dirty on the way home.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: awesome1126 on June 19, 2012, 03:04 pm
Thanks again for all the tips, seems tent-hopping is the best way to go. Any advice on where undercovers usually hang/what to look out for? Are they just waiting at their tent for someone to come up and try to sell them drugs? I feel like there would be many more arrests if they were, or there simply aren't that many undercovers present and they're more concerned with the concert/shakedown area...

Any more tips/advice? LETS NOT GET OWNED BY THE STUPID DRUG LAWS.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: slybootz on June 19, 2012, 04:57 pm
Quote from: awesome1126 on June 19, 2012, 03:04 pm
Thanks again for all the tips, seems tent-hopping is the best way to go. Any advice on where undercovers usually hang/what to look out for? Are they just waiting at their tent for someone to come up and try to sell them drugs? I feel like there would be many more arrests if they were, or there simply aren't that many undercovers present and they're more concerned with the concert/shakedown area...

Any more tips/advice? LETS NOT GET OWNED BY THE STUPID DRUG LAWS.
I've only seen a couple of actual undercover busts go down in front of me, the most recent at Summercamp. The dude who set up camp next to me was selling mad amounts of liquid and rolls. I probably passed him at least 10x walking up and down shakedown street saying "liquid, liquid, liquid" over and over.  All of a sudden while we were grilling up some hot dogs, this dude gets tackled and pinned down by four plain clothed undercovers.  I assume he had just sold to one of them and was taken down for that.  But the dude was ridiculously spun out since he was handling so much liquid, so his judgement was also likely impaired.

I tend to see the most busts happen earlier on in the festival, like Friday.  I don't think LE is gonna sit at a campsite and wait for someone to walk up, they're almost certainly gonna be on shakedown street.

If you're really trying to move some real weight, the safest way would be to work in pairs with a partner.  One does the talking but carries nothing on him, the partner carries the product and takes the money.  This works well as a distraction tactic, since if you DO end up getting caught trying to sell, you will have nothing on you personally, and it gives your partner time to scatter.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: InTransit on June 19, 2012, 07:02 pm
See you all in the Forest or maybe if we are lucky we will be neighbors on the camp grounds. I can't wait to be back in the forest we are rolling up with a nice crew as well this year so it should be some good times. Your best bet is do sell in the campgrounds. So many people walk around selling anything you could ever want. I will be doing the same but the key is make sure you aren't being followed when you go back to your site. Never carry to much on you as well. The drive there is the scariest part. I was holding vials of liquid K, lots of bud, and MDMA. the drive up was the scariest part because there were so many people pulled over on the way there and the cops pull all of your shit out of your car. They are looking for people who look like they are going to EF(every person i saw pulled over 20+ people in the state of Michigan were all heading to EF) and just pull you over but def watch your speed follow the laws make sure you have plenty of visibility out of your windows as well nothing blocking your view because they will pull you over for that. also if you have passengers make sure they stay seated and don't jump around in the car. Nothing will give you away or get you pulled over like your friends hopping from seat to seat. I know they will be excited but keep them calm you will get there and they you can run around like wild children, If you are taking a lot i would recommend putting it in a door panel or welding a box under your car in a wheel-well. Just be smart and you will be good. Also if you do get busted with a little amount or any amount. deny deny deny going back to your campsite.

Hope to see you all in the forest  ;D

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: caffeine_me on June 21, 2012, 03:52 am
EDC
Day one 30mg of Adderall earlier in day with 240mg of MDMA over the evening
Day two 100mcg of WoW with a zyprexa in AM when done
Day Three Pure amphetamine pill,  300mg of MDMA and small amount of K in the AM with a valium for recovery

All three nights were life changing.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: caffeine_me on June 21, 2012, 07:26 am
I am usually a day walker.  It was hard to adjust to the 7pm to 6 am routine.  I spread the M doses over three 120, 70, 50 ( I can't remember the last for sure if I took it?) to keep it going.  Day three I hadn't recovered from Day 1 M, so had to up to up the doses to get the same place.  170, 70, 60 (didn't need the last, but it was EDC).
The lucy in the middle is what made it all stick........I was back to work, with a glow that still is going.

The valium is what gently glides me back to reality.  The safest of the benzos with a very long half life that gives it a gradual onset and a gradual release.  Probably more for the amphetamine added to the weekend, tend to get some muscle cramping and anxious that valium completely takes away.  I saved the valium until the very end, because taking it earlier would have killed all future MDMA/Lucy/Amphet attempts for 40-60 hours.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: slybootz on June 22, 2012, 03:41 am
Quote from: Tryptamine on June 22, 2012, 01:14 am
Might end up at Electric Forest after all, anyone have any tips on the security there? I've never been.

This will be my 4th time at Rothbury a.k.a. Electric Forest.  They kinda stepped up security a tiny bit after switching from Rothbury to Electric Forest, though it's mostly the same.

There are two basic stages to the security system:
1)  Entering the campgrounds. - You camp next to your car, so all cars are "searched" when you're entering the campgrounds (also if you decide to leave and re-enter with your car, you will be re-searched).  The vehicle search was never really intense; '08 and '09 I didn't even have to step out of my car, just open the trunk(assume they were just checking for nitrous tanks or smuggling people inside without a ticket).  Last year, I did have to actually step out of the vehicle and they did a decent search.  They confiscated a bag of charcoal and a few tiki torches from me, but failed to find my charcoal grill, my other bag of charcoal, or any of my drugs...lol.  Depending on how much product you're bringing in, you would be safe buying a few of those hidden can-style safes(look like and are weighted like a regular can of coke or iced tea, but the top unscrews and its a stash box).  I bought a couple Arizona Iced Tea(24oz tallboys) stash cans at a local headshop for about 10 bucks apiece, I fill up all my drugs inside, screw them back together, and throw them in a cooler with some legit cans of the same Arizona Iced Tea.  If you're bringing in serious weight, maybe think about a hidden panel or something, but honestly they don't check that hard.  Just be careful when driving TO Rothbury, MI....once you're within 20 miles of the festival, pay super close attention to speed limit and traffic signals.  Local cops will do everything they can to pull festival-goers over, since almost everyone is riding dirty with some sort of illicit items.

2) Entering the Stages - Most, if not all, of your vending will be done at the campgrounds, so if you made it past step one, then you're fine.  If you want to have doses/rolls/other items to sell at the actual stages, you'll need to be a little craftier.  Security will pat you down, look through your bags and everything.  Personally, I have a baseball hat that has a hidden stash pocket built into it that can easily fit 30+ rolls, or 50+ capsules without making my hat look bulgy.  You could do something like that, or you could crotch it, or a backpack with secret pockets, stuff it in your sock, get those boxer briefs with the hidden stash pocket, etc.  The don't allow drinks inside the stage areas, unless its either an unopened water/gatorade, or an empty bottle.  Also, a lot of the security people that are checking bags are volunteers that are only working for a free ticket, so they might just send you right through without a check.  But they DO hire outside security also, so just be safe.

As far as vending, I posted earlier in this thread on general rules to stay safe while vending.

Have fun!  Make a lot of people happy with LEGIT and PURE drugs! 

Also, I suggest that you eat a ton of acid, mda, mdma, some 2c-x's, ketamine, and vape a huge breakthrough dose of DMT while lying in a hammock in the Sherwood Forest at night.  Literally, you will BELIEVE that YOU are the "Carl" that everyone's been looking for for all these years................. :o

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: caffeine_me on June 23, 2012, 02:58 am
Quote from: sotismea on June 22, 2012, 01:59 am
Quote from: caffeine_me on June 21, 2012, 07:26 am

The lucy in the middle is what made it all stick........I was back to work, with a glow that still is going.

The valium is what gently glides me back to reality.  The safest of the benzos with a very long half life that gives it a gradual onset and a gradual release.  Probably more for the amphetamine added to the weekend, tend to get some muscle cramping and anxious that valium completely takes away.  I saved the valium until the very end, because taking it earlier would have killed all future MDMA/Lucy/Amphet attempts for 40-60 hours.

wow really interested in this thing valium, recently i have been very anxious on my shroom and lsd trips, will valium help with that? also is it legal ? where can i buy it?

Legal with a Rx and purchased from your local pharmacy.  It is also one of the only true "muscle relaxants" vs the typical (Flexeral, Soma) that really do not relax muscle.  I would just mention to your doc that you only occasionally have anxiety/panic that includes muscle tightness.  You had a friend tell you that diazapam (Valium) seems to be the safest benzo....they will agree, because most benzo dependents want xanax only.  Or just purchase at your friendly SR vendors.  Caution, avoid alcohol, narcotics, other sedating medicines and remember the half life of valium is ~50 hours.  Another shorter acting drug with less respiratory suppression would be like Zyprexa, or Seroquel (Atypical Anti-psychotics, with turn off the run away thoughts/visuals with psychedelics)...those are not even a controlled substance as far as I know.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on June 26, 2012, 04:19 pm
Quote from: Dread on June 25, 2012, 07:13 pm
I sure do wish someone on Silk Road would sell LSD for a price comparable to what you'd see at a festival.

That's for true.


Last weekend at a 800 person festival i found a ten strip of WoW for 60$.. That's a festival with only 800 fucking people. You would think some of the big time European dealers on here could beat a couple of Midwestern hippies on acid prices, but i guess not!

I always come on here considering buying LSD, then I'll go to a festival and get a tenstrip for 100$ tops.

SR is where it's at for MDMA though, at least it was before everyone ran out..



Also speaking of Midwestern fests, this year is a good year for 'em. I've already been to two, and I'm going to All Good and Shangri-lah still.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: awesome1126 on July 03, 2012, 02:09 pm
I tested 10 different batches of LSD at EFF, only 1 came back as LSD. Needless to say I picked up a sheet it and it is good! Not as strong as USD's, but on par with 3janes Seed of Life. I ended up giving away ten more test kits, and only a few people told me their doses came back as LSD. I also heard of a lot of meth going around as MDMA. Besides these bunk reports, EFF was the experience of a lifetime, the good vibes there were incredible. I cried coming back because I simply could not imagine being happier anywhere else in the world.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on July 03, 2012, 06:27 pm
Quote from: Legosyrgic on July 03, 2012, 05:24 pm
Any electric forest like festivals in the mid south like around Texas, Arkansas, Tennessee, new mexico, Colorado, coming up soon?

The thing that makes electric forest so special is the amazing forest. To my knowledge there's not many festival venues that have such a big, mythical looking forest.

Harmony Park is a great venue, but quite small. Not to mention it's in Minnesota.


I'd love to go to Electric Forest, but I'm not that into EDM. By all means, I love womps and wicked beats, but i can only take so much.

Just keep an eye out for local fests around you man. If you go, bring good people and great vibes, it'll be a great time whether you get to rage it in a huge forest or a big open field.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: stolea2269 on July 09, 2012, 08:53 pm

Oh well! Live and learn. Still had a great time in the forest. I wish I had been around for Rothbury though, I've heard that was the most amazing festival.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on July 09, 2012, 08:56 pm
Quote from: Festivalia on July 09, 2012, 06:41 pm
Went in Mighty High Mountain fest in May with a bunch of Sour Diesel Man's hash(in the form of lemon bars) and his sour D. Was quite fun. Also, Electric Forest was pretty fun.... not as fun as Rothbury 2009, which is half the reason I went to EF.

Lot's of youngin's selling beat drugs at EF this year though.

All Good Music festival in Thornville Ohio(formerly in WV, MD, etc) is the place to be. More drugs than the Silk Road!

And if anyone is going to All Good... be sure to show some love to Heady Ruxpin late night!
Camped next to that dude at Electric Forest... he's like a modern day Jim Morrison if he chose Molly and Dubstep over Mescaline and Roock & Roll... hahahaha

Fucking love festival season. :)

I didn't go to EF, my buddies did though. He said someone went thru his camp and found his stash can and took his MDMA out of it.


I'll be at All Good!! I won't be working though. I 'might' bring a little extra MDMA, but it all depends on how future orders look.

I'm not gonna be working L, cus the only dude i know who has it in town, i'm not too cool with (he can be a tool) and I'm not gonna buy a sheet off here and charge 20$ a hit, 150$ a strip.. I'd feel bad, and I'd get laughed at.


Hope to see some of you guys on the lot!
Title: Re: Festivals!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: slybootz on July 09, 2012, 11:22 pm
Quote from: stolea2269 on July 09, 2012, 08:53 pm
Oh well! Live and learn. Still had a great time in the forest. I wish I had been around for Rothbury though, I've heard that was the most amazing festival.

Not to brag or anything ;) , but rothbury '08 changed my life.  Then rothbury '09 completely shattered and then carefully reassembled my entire ego and consciousness.  I guess cheese and the dead will do that to you... not to mention umphreys pretty much every night and tribe.......

I hope next years EFF adds more jam to the lineup.  I mean, I get it, it's the ELECTRIC forest, so electronic music should have a big presence, but I still need more jam!  I understand cheese must have thrown down a bit of funding to help re-invent the festival after the 2010 hiatus when Double JJ ranch was having financial troubles, so it makes sense that they would want to be the main jamband attraction. 

Either way, I will be there for my fifth time in Rothbury, MI next year :P

BTW, besides cheese, my highlight of this year was probably Beats Antique; it was mindblowing!

I'm considering Bestival; it is between that or Dimensions Festival in Croatia. (http://www.dimensionsfestival.com/)

I'd prefer Dimensions as it would be almost guaranteed sunshine; being from Ireland, I could really do with a fix of sunshine!

The line-up for both is pretty good! I'd highly recommend Little Dragon, Spiritualized and SBTRKT, Django Django and New Order. Saw them all this year and  they were nothing short of EPIC!

Title: Re: Festivals!

I'm not really a fan of her, but the show should be fun anyway.

Dimensions sounds class alright, so i'll be heading for there if my budget permits. If not, i'll be heading to Bestival.
Either way, i'll be in for a quality weekend. Little Dragon were brilliant a few weeks ago, had Body&Soul rocking over here. Can't say I know Kode9, but will definitely check them out.
I'd also recommend John Talabot; he is top notch. If you like SBTRKT, FourTet etc, you'll like this guy ;)

Here is one of his tracks:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lyyzx_Nq0-Y

Enjoy!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: joepinko on July 13, 2012, 03:03 pm
Quote from: Festivalia on July 09, 2012, 07:03 pm
:o Yeah, most of the LSD sold out there is beat.

If you want good drugs at festivals, 9 times out of 10 it's the fucked-up looking, dirty, hairy hippy dude with tones of pins on his hat/bag.

Who not to buy drugs from @ festivals:

1. That frat-boy looking kid selling "fire doses" that you see man-handling the strips/sheets care-free with no gloves or foil or anything.
There's a dime-a-dozen of these asshats, and they're easy to find. Their prices are higher than they should be(for LSD) and their blotter is 9 times out of 10 is some kind of pastel-colored art blotter, with a bitter ether-y taste to it.

2. Any black dude that doesn't look like Jimi Hendrix or Lennie Kravitz... basically, if they don't look like they would listen to the music playing at the venue... they're probably just scammers trying to make a buck on some dumb young white kids.

3. "Raver girls" - Another dime-a-dozen scam artist. There will always be mildly cute to smokin' hot girls... barely wearing anything except a lot of glowsticks and body paint, who have "awesome molly" ... but 9 times out of 10 it's artificial sweetener, or a concoction of drugs crushed and mixed. They know they can get you because they know how to cut it up enough so that it tastes ok... but it's always powdery, and cheaper than it should be (50 a gram? 60 a gram?)

Who to buy drugs off of at festivals:

1. Me.

2. Any road-worn dead-head with like 50 13 pt lightning bolts in forms of tattoos, badges, pins, etc. Look for the guy who looks like he hasn't stopped tripping L for 10 years... basically.

3. Anyone willing to reagent test their own products on the spot. Most experienced festie dealers come prepared.

...and remember. You can't fake fire nugs. :D

Bisco... be careful if you're importing... lots of UNCLEs(under cover law enforment) at Bisco the last couple years.

Gonna have to disagree with you in regards to buying drugs from wooks. Its all luck if you don't have kids you know that are legit to deal with. Do not get me wrong, vets will have good stuff sometimes, but those same dudes are also more likely to have some kind of dope habit going on and more willing to bunk you.

I will say that on tour there are many that feel it is totally within their right to bunk or short custies left and right.

As for the "raver kids", Phish around 1998-99 start to get a big influx of these type of kids. I was sort of one of them myself. You know the type, the kids that are bumping DnB or Hip Hop out in the lot. Often, these kids had the best MDMA and would have connections for other good shit like Foxy or 2C-B. For whatever reason, that whole look became popular and now everyone kind of emulates it. But I can tell you that for a long time these were usually the ones that were most legit.

Of course, at the end of the day it all comes down to the person. Some people are cool, some are dicks. The whole festival culture didn't really blow up till recently, it kinda changed the game. You are less likely to see the same people over and over again nowadays.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Trainwrecked on July 15, 2012, 07:54 am
Over 1500 people are going to chicagos peacefest campout. Relatively small but looks like it'll be fun. Ill be there next weekend. Just wish I had LSD.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Drksdfmn138 on July 15, 2012, 11:08 am
Every year around this time we get ready to head out to Underground Sounds. I was lucky enough to be a part of that festival every year it happened. From the Cave, to Camp Zoe, to Hogrock Ranch. Such a blast each year, just too bad Tom Foolery pretty much lost everything this last year. Even tho alot of the artists didn't show up, I had a ton of fun. Always on the lookout for the groundscores. I remember taking the newbies to "the lookout" at the Cave. So many good memories. I just wish It was still gonna happen cause I guess I won't be able to make a festival this year... my legs hurt too much anyways these days so I'd have to come stocked to the gills with goodies. Not that we ever didn't.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Chief Breakeverything on July 16, 2012, 01:02 pm
Alright, I need some help. I've got a festival coming up and some MDMA capsules, its the first year I've tried to get shit in and I know from the years before that they have sniffer dogs out the front while you line up. I was thinking of taking the battery out of my mobile, putting them in there and pretending like I'm talking to someone on the way in. Or is there just a universally better way of getting stuff in?
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: sselevol on July 16, 2012, 04:08 pm
Quote from: Chief Breakeverything on July 16, 2012, 01:02 pm
Alright, I need some help. I've got a festival coming up and some MDMA capsules, its the first year I've tried to get shit in and I know from the years before that they have sniffer dogs out the front while you line up. I was thinking of taking the battery out of my mobile, putting them in there and pretending like I'm talking to someone on the way in. Or is there just a universally better way of getting stuff in?
It's likely they're not trained to sniff out MDMA but if you're trying to get them in and want to be safe put them in an airtight container and make sure you wash the container on the outside afterwards. Dogs smell like we see, and will see the different things that make up a smell, so a field at a festival could be grass, smoke, beer and marijuana, and the dog will trained to notice that smell and move towards it. Masking it or having it in your phone won't help if they've been trained to find it.

http://www.cannabisculture.com/node/8634
Read this for more information :)
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: winterland77 on July 17, 2012, 04:26 am
anyone gonna be at Vibes this weekend in Bridgeport, CT? Looking to pick up some heady doses. My friends actually found some ALD-52 at Camp Bisco this past weekend. Sure would like to find some of that stuff or any other solid L.
Cheers
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: thyme on July 17, 2012, 05:07 am
Quote from: sselevol on July 16, 2012, 04:08 pm
Quote from: Chief Breakeverything on July 16, 2012, 01:02 pm
Alright, I need some help. I've got a festival coming up and some MDMA capsules, its the first year I've tried to get shit in and I know from the years before that they have sniffer dogs out the front while you line up. I was thinking of taking the battery out of my mobile, putting them in there and pretending like I'm talking to someone on the way in. Or is there just a universally better way of getting stuff in?
It's likely they're not trained to sniff out MDMA but if you're trying to get them in and want to be safe put them in an airtight container and make sure you wash the container on the outside afterwards.
MDMA is part of the standard dog qualifying package, as far as I know, and it is safest to assume a working dog will alert to it or has been trained at one time to alert to it... so treat this like a shipping question.
Seal anything as late as possible before you go in, as in the morning you leave, and keep it cooler rather than warmer. You have this luxury, unlike a shipper.
Seal it airtight, as sselevol wrote, - which is not a ziploc bag or saran wrap.   This one time maybe regular plastic food-saver type sealing would be OK, double-sealed, since it's *very* short-duration, although I still would use the barrier bags instead. You can make a little ravioli-type pouch with some effort, depending on your sealer. If you can, trim off the pointy corners, depending on where you're carrying it. :)
Submerge in water and look for leaks, then wash.
^All of this is how my kennel club hides stealth dog bait when training for scent work for utility class, we've really improved at this. Or canned using low-heat method in glass jars - but I'm guessing a festival with dogs doesn't allow glass.

Worth going later in the crowd when dogs start to fatigue. Maybe there are festivals that are smart enough to rotate the dogs through, I haven't seen this, but limited exposure to dog-using events. They seem to be for show, largely, to reassure the parents/citizenry, and when I've watched them they're wilting pretty fast. The dogs, not the parents.

OK, obsessive, I know, but I am pretty good at sneaking things past my own dog, who checks me over every day thoroughly - and hasn't found anything in weeks. I can have fresh chicken in those pouches and it gets by. There's kind of a knack to making little "treat ravioli," but it's not hard.

Those were the days eh? When one could buy some acid at a festival and not worry about it being an RC

Some of the best L I ever had was out of Schwagfest.  Unfortunately I never got to go to that or Zoe while I was living out that way.  I cannot say enough good things about the midwest scene.  Never was I sold bunk.  Not once.  I even met more than one group of people that were very conscious about what they were selling.  All very quick to insist that you did not take too much of their product, as it was never bunk.

To anyone that was at WSP 10, PL 10, any of the Squad, or any Schwagg show in Ltown much love!  Can't find that respect where I'm at now.  :'(

I went to the last Schwag show last week... I used to go to Schwagstock too with my friends and girlfriend, but it got shut down and the owner (the bassist Jimmy) got stuck with some weird drug law from the Reagan admin. that has to do with your property/assests being used for drug sales or something like that.  He's gonna do a little time but him and the band have a lot of support out here!

It's gonna suck tho, they did a show every Tuesday.

I honestly haven't really been to much outside the Midwest. I went to All Good this weekend and there were some East coast people there that i met, and they were all really cool.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DivineMomentsofTruth on July 25, 2012, 11:32 pm
Schwag was the shit always a good time and the drugs were real. But you can't generalize that to all of the midwest...not to hate but go to Summercamp and trust me you'll find the bunk version of every drug known to man. Not saying there aren't good drugs there as well but you have to be just as careful in the midwest as the coast. I tested 4 different peoples "molly" that walked through my camp site at waka this year. Tested with marquis...3 turned yellow...indicating methylone or something similar the best reaction I saw turned dark purple in about 4 or 5 seconds and then suddenly went to yellow. Meaning it had mdma in it but was cut.

Ive ordered from many of the big mdma vendors and have always had a dark purple/black reaction with fizzing and some smoke....some reactions in under 1 second.

We are all very lucky to be a part of such a wonderful community!!

Cheese for new years !!! Thats going to be better than most festies this summer!

Title: Re: Festivals!

This is true. Even at Schwag there was bunk shit. Just not nearly as much as other fests.

At waka i saw hella ppl selling bogus shit. I saw two ppl with moonrocks that looked good. Another guy came by saying he had "sass/MDMA combo"

It was crystal but they were these tiny, uniform hexagon crystals. Definitely didn't look like any MDMA i've ever seen.

I tried selling some of Pf's stuff, but had trouble cus it was finely crushed, and I could tell most people didn't believe me when i told them it was crystal MDMA that had been crushed.

Honestly though, I'd be weary of someone saying something like that.


there was hella good LSD at All Good though
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: joepinko on July 27, 2012, 05:35 pm
Quote from: winterland77 on July 17, 2012, 04:26 am
anyone gonna be at Vibes this weekend in Bridgeport, CT? Looking to pick up some heady doses. My friends actually found some ALD-52 at Camp Bisco this past weekend. Sure would like to find some of that stuff or any other solid L.
Cheers

Not trying to be a jerk, but that is highly highly unlikely. People in the early 2000s used to sell "Mescaline", when in reality all it was 2c-i, 2c-t-4 etc etc.
I used to say "no really, what is it".. they would say "Its mescaline man" and I would be like "no man, really, I might be interested in it" and sure enough they would say "2c-whatever"

Also, lots of people have no idea what they are selling, they just get fronted with "work" and then go out and pushed it.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: smith85 on July 30, 2012, 07:47 pm
Just got back from FloydFest in Floyd, VA. Shit was sick.

Lots of people claiming to be selling lucy. Bought a 10 strip from a dude who seemed legit (I know, right?). A friend bought some too from the same gay and later that night told me it definitely wasn't lucy, but was still a lot of fun. So now the only thing I am upset about is not knowing what it is but still enjoying it.

I had some DOC on blotter than I brought and gave some to friends to take one night. They all loved the energy it gave and the way it made you feel like you controlled the music while dancing. Took 3 tabs myself before Leftover Salmon, but don't remember a single thing from the show even though I was there. I do remember tripping hardcore during Conspirator and later for ArtOfficial before wandering around the grounds until about 4am. DOC is definitely more fun than LSD for festivals, in my opinion, solely because of the energy it gives.
