heard on a festival site that they found out it was a preplanned sting that included several law enforcement offices from nearby counties. They gave out of 600 felonies I heard. Somehow bust "5" international dealers....have no idea how they could prove that.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: TheAbsurd on August 22, 2012, 11:21 pm
I'm starting to think this topic is a bad idea for that same reason.  Or do you think LE simply knows there will be drugs at these events no matter what we post?

I was initially going to mention a smaller festival but I'm not going to taint the festival, not to mention there is truthfully a lot more to (this) and all festivals than drugs. A lot of people that go are past the their drug-phase and go for many many many other reasons.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: nosaj_thing on August 23, 2012, 12:40 am
i think a bit of discretion is probably a good idea but LE is just perfectly aware of the some of the things that go on at music festivals, especially heavily electronic ones. and especially in the fucking southeast US

from the sounds of it gnarnia had pretty rookie organization and management, and was totally hustled by sheriff's departments around it. i also heard the main organizer (who i won't name but it's no big secret) was popped in TN a little while back and was facing felony charges. lots of creepy speculation on gnarnia's facebook pages...

at any rate, this is probably a reasonably secure place to discuss simply attending festies, and perhaps speculating what drugs might & might not be there....
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: psychedelicmind on August 23, 2012, 11:23 am
Quote from: TheAbsurd on August 22, 2012, 11:21 pm
I'm starting to think this topic is a bad idea for that same reason.  Or do you think LE simply knows there will be drugs at these events no matter what we post?

I was initially going to mention a smaller festival but I'm not going to taint the festival, not to mention there is truthfully a lot more to (this) and all festivals than drugs. A lot of people that go are past the their drug-phase and go for many many many other reasons.

LE definitely know that there will be drugs at music festivals. The thing is though, the organisers of these festivals need people on drugs, because if people were just drinking alcohol, there would be war  as people become more aggressive when they are full of booze. Whereas, on drugs they get a love buzz and want to hug everyone. The job of security would be a lot harder at these festivals if no one took drugs. Just my opinion anyway.

For me, it doesn't make sense to bust people (a lot of them tax payers), who in a lot of cases are using recreational drugs to blow off a little steam, when there are people dealing drugs openly on the streets of cities. LE in a lot of cases are too afraid of these street dealers, so they go after the easy collar at the festivals. It gets under my skin to say the least!

Anyway, rant over! :)
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on August 23, 2012, 07:52 pm
Quote from: psychedelicmind on August 23, 2012, 11:23 am
Quote from: TheAbsurd on August 22, 2012, 11:21 pm
I'm starting to think this topic is a bad idea for that same reason.  Or do you think LE simply knows there will be drugs at these events no matter what we post?

I was initially going to mention a smaller festival but I'm not going to taint the festival, not to mention there is truthfully a lot more to (this) and all festivals than drugs. A lot of people that go are past the their drug-phase and go for many many many other reasons.

LE definitely know that there will be drugs at music festivals. The thing is though, the organisers of these festivals need people on drugs, because if people were just drinking alcohol, there would be war  as people become more aggressive when they are full of booze. Whereas, on drugs they get a love buzz and want to hug everyone. The job of security would be a lot harder at these festivals if no one took drugs. Just my opinion anyway.

For me, it doesn't make sense to bust people (a lot of them tax payers), who in a lot of cases are using recreational drugs to blow off a little steam, when there are people dealing drugs openly on the streets of cities. LE in a lot of cases are too afraid of these street dealers, so they go after the easy collar at the festivals. It gets under my skin to say the least!

Anyway, rant over! :)

I feel ya brother. I used to go to a festival that was recently shut down, because it was very open with drugs use and sales. It was on a private property, and the guy who owned the property was in a Dead tribute band that threw the fest. So he never let LE on the grounds, he hired his own security staff that really didn't give a fuck as long as you weren't working crack/H/nitrous, although occasionally those things could be found...

Long story short, that place is no more. It was a beautiful location, full of beautiful people ( some crazy ones as well) and great drugs. Plus Dead tunes all weekend? Fuck yeah. A lot of people called this place Home. As more an more people realized you go there and get pretty much anything, feds started having undercovers.


I'm really stoned so I'm probably not explaining my point very well, but my point is that there pretty much needs to be a happy medium of this at festivals. Every one can pretty much assume drug use is going to happen at festivals. But when people start selling it openly and people start getting hurt from irresponsible use/bunk shit, enforcement is going to take more of an interest.

If your working, walk around campsites and meet people. I like that way better anyway, you get to meet more cool people, and you can score some free beers time to time.
Just my .2 BTC
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: ralph123 on August 26, 2012, 04:39 am
yea we have a lot of cool shit here in the summer with outdoor concerts and shit
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: fartsinthewind on August 27, 2012, 02:33 am
That Gnarnia festival was straight up out of control. Check this story one of my friends on FB posted. It's too crazy not to be true!!


Crazy story from my boy [name redacted]: "We camped next to a group of four hotties. 1st night, one of 'em asks if I want to smoke rock. She comes into my tent, yadda yadda yadda, she's tossing my salad, it's crazy. Whole tent is a fog. I've got about six tenths of this clean shard, swallow half. She licks my cack, sprinkles the rest on it, and tells me to f- her in the butt. I guess this is called "plunging", but I always thought it was BS. Who does this? But here she is and she wants it. So, in it goes. She hollers, like, loudly. Then BAM! the tent fly zips open and two cops come in all hunched over with flashlights. They pull us apart, me with a chili dog. She's laughing. I don't know why. Maybe the shard hits fast that way. I yell something like "Whoa! Courtesy! Two fucking minutes!" The younger cop laughs. The tent smells like crack smoke and a little bit like poop. Turns out that these cops were using infrared goggles and could see us hitting the chubba through the wall of the tent. Well, by this time all they could find was one bowl and an empty baggy. I took a pee in the cop car. I got a lawyer on retainer for 5K. Don't know about her."

I literally didn't know whether to laugh, cry, or puke after reading this gem!!
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: TheAbsurd on August 27, 2012, 03:01 am
That's some fucked up shit. I understand if they're going after dealers but just random users? I would hate to be paranoid about something as simple as smoking weed in my home base (tent).

I literally didn't know whether to laugh, cry, or puke after reading this gem!!

how weird... heh heh sorry to burst your bubble but this is a well known copypasta popular on festie/jam band web forums, especially phantasy tour. i've seen it placed at wakarusa, bonnaroo, electric forest, and summercamp. not sure if it's a real story or not (infrared goggles??), but it definitely wasn't from gnarnia, it's been around far longer than that. not that gnarnia wasn't a fucked up festival. and yes people were arrested simply for consuming personal drugs. fucked up shit

at any rate, if she exists, i hope to meet that chick at the next festie i'm at :)

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Notny on September 02, 2012, 11:38 pm
Quote from: TheAbsurd on August 29, 2012, 02:26 am
Going to a festival is right up there with losing your virginity and taking acid at least once.

I guess i'll have to add going to a festival to my bucket list.  Any thoughts on recommended drugs to take at a festival and should I be planning to stay for more than a day?  Any important tips/advice to make my first festival awesome would be great.  Thanks.   :D
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: nosaj_thing on September 03, 2012, 04:58 am
^^^^^

well i suppose on what sort of music festival you are going to, and what drugs you are into. but for me

good supply of psychedelics. lsd and shrooms are pretty classic festie drugs. ive been enjoying 4-aco-dmt instead of shrooms lately. i think almost any psychedelic you are familiar with would go well at a music festival. in addition, if you are into rave/edm sorts of music and fests, a good supply of mdma/rolls is a definite must. i always bring twice as much per night as i normally would take, as it seems to go faster :P

i always have some landing gear for coming down/sleep. benzos and opes, or both. and of course bud, if youre into that. and nitrous too

shit i guess almost any drug lol. drink lots of H20 and stay out of the sun
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DeadRa7 on September 03, 2012, 10:31 am
Anybody catch north coast this weekend?  Shit was poppin, just broke my festival cherry and i'm fucking hooked, it was such an amazing experience.

EDM <3
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on September 04, 2012, 12:58 pm
I got a bunch of buddies who went to North Coast, they go every year. They say it's wicked fun but idk if i can handle a couple days of straight beats. I love EDM, but I love bluegrass, jam bands and funk too. That's why I love festivals like Wakarusa, they have a little bit of everything, but heavy on the jam side.

In the winter there's a lot of awesome raves around the city, so Summer is my time to travel and see a bunch of psychedelic jams, whereas in the Winter i settle down at home and go to raves.


Caught Phish in STL last week, quite the experience to say the least, 3Jane's amazing blotters had a hand in that.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mrambulancedriver on September 04, 2012, 10:48 pm
Quote from: nosaj_thing on September 04, 2012, 06:19 pm
damn i was supposed to go to see STL but i had to work :(

i heard this weekend's show at Dick's in CO was mindblowing

It was my first time seeing them, it was wild. Mound, Sloth, Reba, the vacuum cleaner jam on I Didn't know and YEM stood out the most. Trey melted my face, Page got in my head and spun me out, Mike and Jon would put me back on track, it was fucking beautiful.


My buddy saw the first night at Dick's, said it was great, it had a bit of a 'phalic' theme i guess, ha

Thanks for the advice.  I'm into all the drugs you mention, but I haven't had a chance to try 4-aco-dmt yet.  Also when I take psychedelics and mdma, my pupil dilates like crazy, so should I expect a bunch of dilated eyed people dancing and walking around me  ::).  I'm just not use to that in public, but it sounds fun.  Also I do plenty of research before I take drugs and I'll make sure to stay safe.  I had a bad trip once because I was in the sun running with no h20, tripping balls  :D.  Thanks again.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: nosaj_thing on September 09, 2012, 10:39 pm
Notny, late night at some festies you are gonna stand out if your pupils ARENT fucking huge. i love all sorts of music and festies, but imo there's just something about late night raves and bass shows that you can't get anywhere else. the crowd, the girls, the drugs, the vibrations... i'm a basshead and a basehead lol

seriously though Counterpoint is less than 3 weeks away! if you are going message me and we will rage fucking hard. here's the lineup/location

http://lineup.counterpointfestival.com/

Notny, late night at some festies you are gonna stand out if your pupils ARENT fucking huge. i love all sorts of music and festies, but imo there's just something about late night raves and bass shows that you can't get anywhere else. the crowd, the girls, the drugs, the vibrations... i'm a basshead and a basehead lol

seriously though Counterpoint is less than 3 weeks away! if you are going message me and we will rage fucking hard. here's the lineup/location

http://lineup.counterpointfestival.com/

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: psychedelicmind on September 16, 2012, 12:30 pm
Just back from Dimensions Festival in Croatia. What a festival it was. Great music, great people and the most scenic place i've ever seen for a festival.

At night, the music was on in the grounds of an old fort. They had stages in the dungeons, in the moat of the fort, the courtyard etc. The line up was pretty epic also. During the day, the music was on a beach. Summer sounds on the beach were nothing short of epic!! The vibe was very relaxed and I couldn't get over how friendly everyone was. The range of drugs available was great also :-)

I met so many cool people and would highly recommend it for anyone for next year!
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: beren102 on September 16, 2012, 09:22 pm

what sort of drugs did you do there?

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: psychedelicmind on September 17, 2012, 07:08 am
Quote from: beren102 on September 16, 2012, 09:22 pm
holy shit dimensions fest sounds fucking insane! an old fort? thats about as gnar an environment as it gets

what sort of drugs did you do there?

Dimensions was insane alright. The first night, I was blown away by the music and the setup of the place!

There was a huge range of drugs available at it. I did LSD, MDMA powder and pills, ketamine and coke. There seemed to be an endless supply, mostly from people visiting. The locals were selling loads of weed, but I don't smoke so didn't buy any.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: k4rts on October 13, 2012, 03:12 am
Quote from: samcrow on October 04, 2012, 04:06 am
tomorrowland 2013  :) :) :) :) :) :)

I will fucking be their. Want to know why I didn't make it this year?

I wake up at 4:45 AM since tickets went on sale at 5 AM my time. Luckily I only had to wait about 5 minutes and it refreshed and brought me to the order page. I input my debit card info click submit yada yada. The next page tells me my order can't be processed because, in other words, my bank thinks this is a fraudulent transaction since I'm buying tickets from Europe. So it kicks me out of line and after waiting for over an hour everything is sold out.

A week later the airline I booked a flight with calls me saying the flight is cancelled and all tickets will be fully refunded. Clearly, it was not meant to be. Tomorrowland 2013, I'll do whatever it takes to be their.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mr.Charlie on October 15, 2012, 01:26 pm
I'm not one for straight Electronic Festivals. By all means I really dig electronic music, in the Midwest here we get some pretty good raves goin', especially in the Winter time.

But I've always been more of a hippie stoner type I guess. I really want to check out Electric Forest, I have friends who went when it was Rothbury, before String Cheese was throwing the festival. They said it's definitely different, but that forest and 3 nights of String Cheese alone would be worth hearing all those womps in between.

Wakarusa was the shit this year. Not too many electronic artist, but who they did have was awesome. Pretty Lights blew my mind, I was on like 20-25mg of 2-cb, at least i think it was like 20mg..

Can't wait till next Summer though, especially now that my LSD collection is growing

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: StatePalaceFun on October 25, 2012, 04:53 am
TICKETS NOW ON SALE ($370 for 3 days; $710 for all 6 days) *crazy, huh?
    Ultra Music Festival 2013 in Miami, now have tickets for sale. I was suppose to get a notice when the early bird tickets were to go on sale. I don't know if they sent me that notice or this is the early bird prices. Apparently, it is a 6 day festival this year. Two weekends, Friday thru Sunday. Problem is, the pricing. It is an awesome festival with the best talent in the world (Thanks to WMC being held at the same time.) They are only selling 3 days tickets and 6 day tickets, at this time. The 3 day tickets are $300 + $70 (fee for idk wtf) and the 6 day is $710...That's with the fee included.
    I know this is a super rave, but damn! $35 for tickets to State Palace Theater, was well worth it. Anytime they charged more than $25, you knew they were having an awesome ass laser show included. They always had the best acts in the biz too. Rabbit in the moon (live), Bad Boy Bill, RHV, Micro, dj Monk, Mix Master Mike, Paul Oakenfold, Micro, dj Dan, etc... I know the 3000-5000 people that would attend State Palace, is not shit compared to the 100k, that will be going to UMF. I even saw UMF on the end of Drugs Inc., Ecstacy.
    Anyway, I know the SR will be representing. I just hope we do it on the down low. Please no shirts with a green camel. I probably will lose my PLUR and punch someone in the face.
I'm looking forward to this festival and maybe someone can create a special thread for it. whoever make it, will have one dandy ass time! haha...I had more fun at Ultra, then I did in Amsterdam for 16 days,,,but that's IMO.

"SP from Gulf Coast"

Quote from: fuckingACE on November 28, 2012, 02:24 am

I'm heading to Dimensions in Croatia. Was there last Summer and it was class. The line-up was the best dance music line up I have ever seen, and the sun shining so it was spot on. Would love to go to Secret Garden Party in the UK as well, so hoping to get a few mates on board. I have been eying up Primavera Sound in Barcelona for the last few years as well. They get a very impressive line up, so I will probably bite the bullet and go there in June as well.

Your plan sounds awesome by the way :)
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: yumyumchicken on November 28, 2012, 07:37 am
Anyone in the southeast should check out Art Basel Miami Beach, and in particular the Moksha Art Fair (mokshaartfair2012.com). Their closing party has Phadroid, Toubab Krewe, Heyoka, Govinda and 30+ other artists for $40, plus a bunch of ridiculous psychedelic art, installations and live painting.

Gonna be crazy, I love visiting the city for Art Basel every year! Burning Man in Miami :-D

I'll probably do a few more festivals mid and late Summer, unless Phish does another Summer tour..
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: anonman88 on November 28, 2012, 09:51 pm
wakarusa was amazing last summer! its in such a beautiful location with a great crowd, i had the most amazing time, except when they shut everything down saturday night because of a "tornado" that never came.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: XxWINxX94x23 on November 28, 2012, 10:42 pm
North Coast in Chicago was incredibly awesome, they've been having it for a few years now and I normally go for 1 day depending on the lineups. Mostly Electronic stuff but there were a few rap/hip-hop acts. Axwell headlined the day I went and it was pure bliss. Not to mention Knife Party right before that, it was sick. Security was pretty lax, lots of awesome things to do, good people all over.

Spring Awakening also in Chicago was the best festival and concert(s) I've ever been to. It was at fucking Solider Field! Skrillex headlined and there were tons of other good names there like Benny Benassi, A-Trak, Tommy Trash, Kill the Noise. Security barely existed and there were many vendors and things available to buy, including food, clothing, accessories and even bowls/pieces! I think its going to be an annual deal so I hope to go back next June!

Never been to Summer Camp but hear great things about it.
Title: Re: Festivals!

i was on some acid, some of skyy's old molly before he went rouge, and had been snorting some k, in the front of the crowd at beats. i was in the perfect zone for beats, it was awesome. i too, remember when they first said the tornado was comming, we all thought it was a joke and started chearing, cause they were like "and the thunder gods". then that douche came back on the mike and was like "no, get the fuck out of here" and all of us in the front are fucked up as shit thinking, wtf is going on, were all too fucked up. it was insane, but i did have a lot of fun. i honestly can't fully explain how i was able to walk back to my campsite in the woods :)

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DivineMomentsofTruth on December 13, 2012, 08:25 am
Quote from: slysamuel0109 on December 11, 2012, 05:42 pm
Going to Waka and Electric Forrest for the first time. Any suggestions or tips for a festival newbie?
If you don't already own on purchase a camelbak.  Both festivals have free water refill stations and having a camelbak is the easiest way to ensure you stay hydrated.  It can get really hot at waka and in combination with drugs and alcohol it is easy to get dehydrated.  Also a headleamp you can strap on to your head is really convenient at night (can also aid in finding ground scores  ;) )  Bring toilet paper and some sun screen!  The portajohns often run out of TP and when they do have it it's shitty single ply stuff that's not really what you want when you have to shit after eating large amounts of chemicals. haha
Also, bring your own drugs...just hide them well..mostly for the drive the security is pretty relaxed at both places...more so waka but use common sense and you shouldn't run into trouble.  Sure you can find good drugs but most of the time it's no where near the quality of what you can find here if you use reputable vendors.

One more thing...Don't forget your tickets!   You're going to have an amazing time at both fests...maybe I'll see ya there ;D
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Festivalia on December 13, 2012, 09:16 am
 :-X [REDACTED]
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DivineMomentsofTruth on December 13, 2012, 11:09 am
Quote from: Festivalia on December 13, 2012, 09:16 am
I recommend actually bringing tester kits, as this will help you identify good drugs(that you may ground-score) and also, may help you make a couple friends!

Great tip, forgot to mention that.  I took my marquis to all the festies I went to last summer (not for my drugs) but for possible ground scores and to help out my neighbors.  It was no surprise to me but at least 80% of the "molly" I tested turned yellow most likely indicating methylone.  Most of the younger kids had never even heard of dance safe let alone having your own test kit in you backpack .  You make plenty of friends and at the very least strike up some fun, and some awkward conversations but I think just spreading the knowledge of the large amounts of bunk or falsely advertised drugs that you can avoid buying will make others want to invest in test kits.  Ultimately, the more people testing their drugs the less amount of bunk drugs that will be at fests.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: anonman88 on December 13, 2012, 07:11 pm
you can get lucky buying drugs at festivals, you just have to know who to ask. i was selling some of skyy's mdma at waka, and everyone was loving it. a friend of mine brought 600g to EF from some reputable sr vendor, not going to say who, and was selling at $90 a gram, everyone loved him :)
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mr.Charlie on December 13, 2012, 09:28 pm
I'll be at Wakarusa too, this'll be my third Waka and my girlfriend's 4th.  Last year was really cool.  I was selling Pfand's MDMA for like 90$ a gram, but a good amount of people were sketched out cus Pfand crushed his stuff down to a powder before shipping, so not many people beleived me when i said it was pure MDMA.

I was also selling pressed kief for 20$ a gram, that shit went QUICK! Looking back I probably shoulda charged a little more for that kief, but I like hooking people up at festivals, s'all good!

Hope I cross some of your guys' paths on a Shakedown St. or two this Summer

Post by: Meatgrinder on December 16, 2012, 01:07 pm
Down here in Aus we don't get the heavy metal festivals like europe and the US do, well, not very often.

We mainly have electronic fests, (summadayze, future music, sets on the beach, parklife, origin, good vibes etc) any aussies on here will know.

Great festivals, great vibes, generally try to attend all as long as I dont have other things on that are more important.

mdma, love to double drop and keep rolling hard. best set would have to be infected mushroom a few weeks ago..!!! mind blowing

About time we got this thread on the subject of JAM festivals!!
Yeah All Good was the shit...but yeah they had know idea what they were doing at the new venue..I love ohio but WV was better imo.  Loads of good people but thats what to expect with the allman brothers and phil and bob and yonder being there.  I have done Scamp for the past 6 years and I actually wasn't going to this year until I saw Trey is playing 2 nights, and sometimes I just need my fix of Moe..and STS9 is just about the only electronic (if you wanna call it that) that I can stand. 

Waka for sure, EFF I probably won't do, I LOVE cheese but I went to both Rothburys and then the last two eff's have just drawn more kids there strictly for the womp womps, the first year was an ok split..there were 2 very different sets of people there I was camped with about 20 people and by the end we knew everyone who was there for bluegrass and cheese, althought I did meet a few cool electronic kids...I was walking around yelling free deeemsters sunday morning asking who wanted to go to church with me and blasted off with about 20 different people at about 10 different camp sites...ohh what fun!
Last year it seemed there were more people there for electronic acts and I personally can't stand the fucking music and can't understand how people can love some guy who stands on stage and pushes buttons....I don't know to each to own I don't want to offend anyone but yes mr charlie lets get this thread back where it needs to be...
I would love to do waanee again...SOS is such a beautiful place.  And then Harvest fest at mulberry mountain where waka is, its probably as good as it gets for me...strictly fucking bluegrass for 4 days and nights.Talk about a chill, cool as crowd.  But...if Phish announces a summer tour that is number one priority!!

where's my buddy Mr Ambulance Driver!?  He'd help us out and get this thread back where it needs to be!
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: anonman88 on December 20, 2012, 05:40 pm
last waka was amazing, has so much fun :) i also went to starscape, which was pretty crazy, but surprisingly dirty, like more dirty then any of the other festivals i went to last summer. they also ran out of water, had the sound for a stage go down, a ton of problems. sonic bloom was pretty fun in colorado, and security was a joke, they weren't checking for drugs, just glass alcohol and tanks. this summer i'm not fully sure what i'll be going to, the only thing i know for sure i want to go to is BM, possibly waka and EF, maybe starscape since its fairly close by, really depends on the line up. also thinking about biscoe and a few others, but really depends on how much money i have as BM is my main priority :)

What is BM?  Wait a minute...were you my neighbor at waka? Does this dialogue sound familiar...? 
So you guys are east coast kids? *yeah*
So you guys love bisco? *yeah
So you guys love K right? *haha yeah how'd you know?

I guess if you were you'd now know where I got those defqons, pink stars, and yellow triforces.
lol, we weren't neighbors, i was selling mdma from sky, camped in westwoods :) and BM is burning man :)

Within 20 minutes they were floored...just hugging me telling me sorry they didn't believe and how bad they wish that the disco biscuits were there hahaha..fucking bisco kids I tell ya
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DivineMomentsofTruth on December 20, 2012, 07:54 pm
Quote from: Festivalia on December 20, 2012, 05:57 pm
I agree. I decided to avoid EF this year as last year was NOT the scene I fell in love with @ the Rothbury festivals. The venue was/is amazing, and god... Cheese, love love love Cheese... but why pay $300 to see a bunch of DJs? I could go 'clubbing' in the cities near me any day of the week. I do like a little late-night dubstep from time to time, but not to the extent Electric Forest pushes it.

I was at the last few All Goods, and I actually liked the Ohio spot... I hate climbing hills though, so it makes sense. haha - Plus, the disorganization made security a joke. I gave one of the security people a glass blunt filled with Christy's Super Lemon Haze so he didn't search my car. Usually I don't have issues, but I brought a lot of shit to All Good last year, and ran out of good places to hide it all. :D

Chances are if you were at All Good in Ohio, we met. I made my way to every single campsite last year, trading and selling chronic, and edibles.
Made out like a bandit. :P


For me this year:       Hang Out, Mighty High, Sasquatch, Wanee, All Good, Bear's Picnic, Waka, Coachella. Obviously gonna have to coin toss once or twice... but I WANT to hit those.

Yeah EF has turned into a place I don't want to be which is a same because I loooove Cheeeese and I love sherwood forest and all its glory but damn those womp womps keep me up...every now and then (usually after 200mg of the finest mdma from SR or a defqon or 2) I can get down to it. 

At the first EF 2011 I believe...I met Billy and Keith Mosley and Lester too! right after there first set I believe it was at a galactic show...no one knew who they were except my group and we tried not to draw attention but damn lester is a funny as dude...and my buddy called it after meeting lester he was like "tomorrow we're getting a lester rant" and sure enough the next night lester was on stage ranting away!
I was along the tree line what edibles did  you have?  Those fudgecicles were flame as fuck dude!

I would love to do hangout, strings and sol and high sierra...never done any of them.  And then of course if any fest Phish phucking throws I'll be at.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mr.Charlie on December 20, 2012, 08:26 pm
While I dig some EDM, it definitely draws a shittier crowd to festivals. I'm still kicking myself in the ass for missing Harvest. My funds just weren't in the right spot at the right time. For all of you who did go to Harvest I hope you checked out Wookiefoot!! Those guys are amazing.

I wanna go to Electric Forest cus I have some friends who are really into Cheese so it would be a blast to go with them. I'd check out a little of the EDM and then just rage to the jams and funk. Get spun out and get lost in the forest.
To this day though I won't stop hearing about Rothbury '09 from my friends.

I've wanted to check out Burning Man but I just can't see myself making it out that way anytime soon. I've been conflicted recently on if I should focus on big or small festivals, so the past few seasons I've just been mixing it up!

I've heard some horror stories from Summercamp, shit about undercovers and just general shitty vibes an shitty drug pushing. But when I saw that initial lineup with Trey, Cornmeal, STS9 and Theivery Corporation, I said FUCK IT




Doing two weekends in a row of S'camp and Wakarusa, hope to see some of you cats out there!
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DivineMomentsofTruth on December 20, 2012, 09:12 pm
Quote from: Mr.Charlie on December 20, 2012, 08:26 pm
While I dig some EDM, it definitely draws a shittier crowd to festivals. I'm still kicking myself in the ass for missing Harvest. My funds just weren't in the right spot at the right time. For all of you who did go to Harvest I hope you checked out Wookiefoot!! Those guys are amazing.

I wanna go to Electric Forest cus I have some friends who are really into Cheese so it would be a blast to go with them. I'd check out a little of the EDM and then just rage to the jams and funk. Get spun out and get lost in the forest.

Doing two weekends in a row of S'camp and Wakarusa, hope to see some of you cats out there!

I know what you mean...my friend who loves edm dragged me to a big gigantic show a few months ago and I forgot what those crowds were like..compared to say...a leftover salmon or cornmeal show..i was getting pushed by 16 year old girls and people were dropping shoulders into each other to push through the crowd..just bad vibes everywhere I went at the show.
Dude I missed harvest last year and was kicking myself in the ass...i pretty much said fuck everything and made it happen even though I really really didn't have the money for it.
Saw wookiefoot the last night at harvest this year...that was my first time,,,they are the shit! and then dirtfoot played right after them to end one of the best weekends of my life.

For me EF was that....like 15 really close friends who are as obsessed with cheese as I was with phish at the time.  I love them both but I lived with 4 diehard cheeseheads for 3 years and now I can't decide who to pick...but why pick one they are both amazing. 
Dude....dude...rothbury 09 was fucking incredible still to this day the cheese show was the absolute most spiritual/joyful/pinnacle moment of my life.  I cried for a lot of it lol...some tears of joy and some was just too many emotions happening it was so overwhelming in the best way possible.

Those horror stories about scamp are true...a neighbor of mine a few years ago got popped selling molly to an undercover with a wrist full of festival bracelets and dreads...Fucked up right?
There are a lot of people there just to sell bunk drugs but bring your own amazing drugs from SR and ignore those fools...there are plenty of good vibes there too...I'd definitely recommend going this year.  Cornmeal usually plays 4 shows...and who knows who else will be announced. I'm hoping another big announcement and not like last years over hyped announcement of janes addiction.  I like JA alright but come on..they acted like it was going to be phish or cheese or allman brothers...or phil lesh...since bob was already there maybe a surprise further set
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: hellwillbetoasty on December 21, 2012, 02:13 am
i mean I did see like 2 people get arrested at scamp. But my GF and I had no problems smuggling in enough drugs to get use through the weekend, and sell to a handful of people. The music was great, I also was disappointed that Janes Addiction was a headliner, but seeing Bob Weir come out with Primus and play 'the other one' was a one in a lifetime experience. truly a beautiful moment.

if anyone ever has a chance to go to a festival at The Gorge in WA, do it. Sasquatch is one huge one, I saw phish there for 2 days and it was incredibly. By far the most beautiful and breathetaking natural amphitheater I have been to, ever.

I'm really excited to hear who Wakarusa is gonna be bringing, since it's their tenth anniversary and all. Dirtfoot throws a free breakfast every year during the festival, it's so much fun. I'm pretty sure they do it at Harvest too. I love that property, it just seems to radiate good vibes.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mr.Charlie on December 22, 2012, 09:21 pm
Quote from: Festivalia on December 22, 2012, 08:50 pm
::) I've seen Phish a few times. Not really my speed... I think it's Trey, honestly, and I mean no disrespect... the dude can shred, but... yeah. That's what it is to me, a shred fest. He'll just go off into space with guitar solos for like, 30 minutes. It's insane! lol

I grew up on the Dead, and classic-rock and associated music with the 60s and 70s to the "hippie" scene, ...until the last 12 years.
Phish turned me off right away, cause I knew a lot of assholes who liked them, and that put me off. I thought instantly Phish fans = Assholes, Phish = Assholes.
Cheese blew my fucking skull off. I was not prepared for them. I had heard some live shit from 98/99... early 2000's... but seeing one of their first shows in years, and it being their only show that year... they were geared up. Plus that epic Rothbury 2009 line-up omg:

The Dead(w/ Warren), Bob Dylan & his band, String Cheese Incident, Willie Nelson & Fam., The Black Crowes, Nas & Damien Marley, STS9(2sets), G. Love & Special Sauce, Gvt Mule, Umphrey's McGee, Broken Social Scene, Yonder Mountain String Band,   The Disco Biscuits, Les Claypool,   Cold War Kids, John Butler, Chromeo, Keller Williams, Ani Defranco(lol), MSTRKRFT, Matisyahu, Girl Talk, Guster, Femi Kuti, Flogging Molly, Martin Sexton, Railroad Earth, Toots & The Maytals, Zappa plays Zappa, Grace Potter & The Nocturnals, Shpongle, Jackie Greene, Lotus, Man Man, Glitch Mob, EOTO, Pretty Lights, Rebelution, Toubab Krewe, Future Rock, Break Science, Lipp Service, The Macpodz, Big Gigantic, bunch of other shit I didn't know or see...

I've never had as much fun at any festival before or since... Line up is everything. If you threw Phish & DMB into that^ the world would definitely end.

Aw man Phish is great. I get where you're coming from on the whole Trey front. I love their keyboardist and drummer, they throw in some really cool, psychedelic shit sometimes. Yeah the jams can go on for awhile, but they're some on point fucking jams.
Trey can fuckin' wail on that geetar though man! I loooove me some Dead, but I like heavy music too. A lot of Dead heads in my area love to talk shit on Phish. Normally though they do it just to get a rise out of Phish kids.

To each his own though.

Cheese is definitley on the top of my 'Next to See' list. I've got a few shows on my computer I listen to from time to time and they're pretty awesome.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mr.Charlie on December 27, 2012, 12:44 pm
Quote from: Festivalia on December 24, 2012, 10:39 pm
::) I love to rage/rave. I'm not saying I don't like bass... I like Bassnectar, love Pretty Lights, Girl Talk, Tiesto, Nero, Skrillex, EOTO, Big Gigantic, etc.

...I just don't like when a bunch of 'kids' who aren't old enough to drink come, get drunk as fuck, and then just start being assholes. Think about when you were in HS... now imagine all those fuckers, wasted, aggressive, shirtless, and not giving a shit about anyone else...

That was the crowd last year. And of the above mentioned, only Bassnectar and EOTO played, and both on Sunday. It was a lot hotter than previous years, and dry as fuck. There was dust everywhere, everyone/everything was filthy, but not in a good way. UNTZ UNTZ UNTZ at 3 pm in the blazing sun, 100 degrees, no tent, limited shade(outside of sherwood) ...

It just failed miserably imo. Cheese even made comments on stage about how young the crowd was, how wild the crowd got, and how it was clear that the majority of people there would rather be listening to Bassnectar. --Dubstep obviously has gotten very popular in mainstream music. Hip-Hop/Pop/Rock... over Dubstep and "liquid bass" lines. Suddenly half the shit on the radio sounds like Skrillex, Nero, or Bassnectar made the beat... and those kids get turned on to 'real' dubstep, and FLOCK to the already crowded festivals. Its just turning into a shit show of careless people, carelessly using drugs and alcohol, being dicks. There were so many kids beating other kids on fake L that these kids start thinking they're immune to LSD. I saw some kid buy a strip from someone I knew of fluff, and he told the kid straight up: "Dude, you're probably good with half a dose. One will definitely free your soul." And this kid was like "oh man, fuck that, im eating 5 this time, cause last time I didnt feel nothin" .... We all go "Seriously?!" at the same time, and my friend snatched it out of the kids hand like "Bro... I don't care if you got ripped off in the past, do NOT just think you're invincible, this is the REAL DEAL." He ate 2. An hour later I saw the kid huddled in a lawnchair with a wet towel over his head, looked like he was having a hell of a come-up. Then like 4-5 Hours later he was back at my campsite, thanking my boy for stopping him from eating more... he was all grins, and black holes. He never made it in to see Cheese that day, but he didn't seem bothered. Saw him again later in the weekend, and he was fried. Obviously got his hands on a lot(too much) of ecstasy. ...Kids...

I feel bad, cus most of those kids that do that shit are my peers. I'm quite young still, and the fact I'm not a careless fool i guess makes me come off as a bit older, cus people (especially fellow festival goers) are a bit surprised when i tell them my actual age.
But yeah, all those stupid ass kids you mentioned, I know them. I had to grow up around them, shaking my fucking head back when the great Family Fluff hit out area and dumb ass 17 yr old girls are downing 3-7 hits at home by themselves, and of course freaking the fuck out.
This new generation is a bit wild (isn't that always said about the new generations though?) and for some of their mindless debauchery, i do apologize.
BUT! I do ask that some of you older heads don't judge all of the youngins' too quickly, cus some of us out there are real heady folks contributing a lot to the scene.

That said, Summercamp and Wakarusa are officially bought! Now time to save for some Mid and Late Summer fests. I'm reallyreallyreally hoping Phish does another Summer tour though, I doubt it, I think Trey's just gonna tour his new solo album.
'Tis OK though, good tunes are good tunes.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Festivalia on December 27, 2012, 06:41 pm
 ::) I won't tell you specifics, but I'm not an "old head" ... despite my avatar. hahahaha

I'm often told I look 8-10 years younger than I actually am... My 'generation' of peers were wild. We still are. But there's a difference between 'wild' and 'wreckless' ...

The youngest 'generation' of adult-teens today are the 'spice and bathsalts' generation. Whenever I'm in a headship that sells spice, or synthetic 'drugs' or "ipod screen cleaner" or whatever the fuck, I'm always tempted to sell these kids REAL drugs. But, then I think about it, and I just don't think they're the same people. Arguing weed vs. spice, is the same argument of DMT vs. Salvia... One is illegal, one is not. Both have 'similar' effects/intensities but appeal to two entirely different types of people. The lure of the illegal substance is "I shouldn't be doing this..." while the lure of the legal substance is... "I can totally get away with this."

It does annoy me that people have the mentality though, that if the substance you want isn't legal... to "create" a "similiar" compound that IS legal. LSD never made anyone eat anyone else's face off.... but then "bathsalts" come along claiming to be "synthetic LSD"... and suddenly news headlines are:

"Man tripping on LSD eats another living mans face!" ...

Next thing you know... some kids gonna smoke a blunt of spice, wreck is car, and they're going to be saying "MARIJUANA CAUSES DEADLY ACCIDENT" ...

Media, the enemy, likes fear monger.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: DivineMomentsofTruth on December 27, 2012, 07:22 pm

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Stonedstupor on December 28, 2012, 05:29 am
I went to wakarusa this year, was my first festival and it was amazing. Not sure if this is normal or not but i constantly have dreams about waka. i remember vividly being in one dream and saying "Dude this is your first time at waka? This is my third time this year!"

Waka changed my perspective on people and drugs alike. I met some of the coolest people there. Saw the dankest weed ever there also-some Nigerian Nightmare this guy brought from CO. 100% Violet color.

I had a couple buddies go to electric forest this year and they had an amazing time also. I wanna go to EF and waka next year if possible
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: jacklinks on December 28, 2012, 05:51 am
Counterpoint was awesome! Great artists, great venue, great atmosphere! I highly suggest going there even if you don't live near Atlanta. The security was so lax. Visible open bottles of alcohol were not taken out of our car. Security patdowns were very lenient as well... my girl only had to do the ole molly in the bra trick to get in.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Stonedstupor on December 28, 2012, 06:04 am
at waka we were smoking a bowl when security came up to door to check us out early. they were tryin to get us in quick. he commented on how strong our bud smelt, asked if we had any "contraband" in the car, of course we said no, stoned as hell, and he said cool and marked us off then on to next car. security at gates within festival grounds to get to shows would feel bags of molly and tupperware containers and let you slide on by. We even brought a big ass bong into one of the bluegrass/jam band shows.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: anonman88 on January 01, 2013, 04:39 am
Quote from: Dankbank1 on December 29, 2012, 02:35 pm
Quote from: Stonedstupor on December 28, 2012, 05:29 am
I went to wakarusa this year, was my first festival and it was amazing. Not sure if this is normal or not but i constantly have dreams about waka. i remember vividly being in one dream and saying "Dude this is your first time at waka? This is my third time this year!"

Waka changed my perspective on people and drugs alike. I met some of the coolest people there. Saw the dankest weed ever there also-some Nigerian Nightmare this guy brought from CO. 100% Violet color.

I had a couple buddies go to electric forest this year and they had an amazing time also. I wanna go to EF and waka next year if possible

Dude I dream of camp bisco alot! vivid as shit in the big tent.

Basslights was fun as shit! Took 100mg mdma and 70mg of mda boy was it crazy.
basslights was fucking epic! the first night blew my mind, i took some LSD, roughly 150uq, about 120mg of MDMA and did a bunch of K. bassnectar's set was insane, i felt like i was receiving a testament as he was preaching through his finger tips. it was a live animal he was controlling. i ended up taking 4 of JOR's lotus tabs the second night, and doing a bunch more K, was quite the trip, can't even explain all the weirdness i saw :P where did you stay? i was at the red roof inn, i wonder if we ran into each other, smoked a cig together or something, would be pretty funny :)

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: mvick07 on January 04, 2013, 08:38 am
Quote from: jacklinks on December 28, 2012, 05:51 am
Counterpoint was awesome! Great artists, great venue, great atmosphere! I highly suggest going there even if you don't live near Atlanta. The security was so lax. Visible open bottles of alcohol were not taken out of our car. Security patdowns were very lenient as well... my girl only had to do the ole molly in the bra trick to get in.

Dude I went to Counterpoint too! It was soooo sick; long drive for me though. The security was actually kind of stressful for me. I showed up at like 9 AM the second day and they literally spent almost 20 minutes digging through my car. They even dumped out my girlfriends ibuprofen etc. bottles. That surprised me honestly, but I got in with everything nonetheless. Can't wait for Ultra this year. Beyond stoked!

Title: Re: Festivals!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: hands off black 7 on January 06, 2013, 12:31 am
Quote from: topia on January 05, 2013, 11:05 pm
Damn, yall a bunch of hippies.  Come on, anyone going to Chaos in Tejas or Maryland Death Fest this year? Fuck all that electronic bullshit and your noodly jam bands.  METAL.

I've got ya back brother in metal..... As much as I love getting googed up and running amok to some awesome mashups at 3am with the ladies and those feminine dressed dudes, and as much as I love acid and eccys and lasers and hard trance, there is nothing as good as being carried away by the heavy wall of sound and musicianmanship that can only come from angry guitars, drums and valve amps.  It's not a tough guy thing, in fact I find metal most soothing at times.
I also love the carefree fun of amphetamines and a live punkrock gig.... In fact, I just fucken love music. Hell, I'd sell my soul to see pink floyd or dire straights....  Even James Taylor blows my mind.

I'm not sure how much people know about this shit call oxytocin, which our brain only releases under certain circumstances. Singing in a group releases it, sex releases it, being in the crowd at a gig where everyone is "feeling it" releases it. Drugs potentiate it.  I feel it's a massive part of what drug users and live music fans are chasing.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: teqqno on January 13, 2013, 07:20 am
DEMF, Movement, whatever you want to call it. Probably the only decent major EDM festival left in the USA.  Not only is there the festival, there's an ungodly amount of epic afterhours parties thrown by some awesome artist.  Its hosted in Detroit, the city that gave birth to techno.  The people there are well educated in the music department. They are there for the music. General admission tix prices are most reasonable for a 3 day festival. None of this $300+ crap

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: greenturtle on January 24, 2013, 03:52 am
Quote from: shakedown street on January 23, 2013, 11:06 am
Quote from: treebeard on January 23, 2013, 12:10 am
Quote from: shakedown street on January 22, 2013, 10:31 pm
Quote from: treebeard on January 22, 2013, 04:07 pm
Quote from: greenturtle on January 19, 2013, 02:28 am

Also, has anybody been to Nelsons Ledges Quarry Park in Ohio? My favorite place in the world would love to find out who has been there.

peace,
GT

I know the place well, can't believe I come all the way to SR forums and see someone from those parts.  Small world afterall

NLQP is a bust nothing but a bunch of narcs running around. That place hasn't been cool since shortly after the current owner purchased it.

ahh, it's a bummer to hear that.  I haven't been around there much in awhile myself

Loved that place as a kid, sucks the owner is a D-Bag

Wow,

Ive been going there the last 17 years, ever since I was 10 and I must respectfully disagree with you. The place has changed some but it all depends on how you handle yourself and the crowd you keep.

I admit, in the early 2000's people would walk around yelling, "fungi, fungi", or "I got doses!", it does not really work that way anymore. Nowadays I bring my own drugs with me, and I only give and receive drugs from good friends, and money is never exchanged.

As far as the company you keep, well look at the times. You have pistol toting, pants saggin, Jordan wearing punks running around trying to sell crack and rob hippies, times are changing. I dont blame them for tightening up.

I had a good experience at Gory at the Quarry this last October. My cousin ate a quarter of Golden Teachers during the end of the Waterband set and he fell out, I just think the visuals and the intense head space got to him, I grew them myself and they were fire. Anyways the medics came and got him, asked me what he was on and I told them the truth. They took him to the medics tent and put him in a cot, when he woke up 30 minutes later they followed him back to our site and told us to have a good night.

I love the place and have never had anything but good experiences there so, I am a little biased, plus I have met alot of cool people there that I llok forward to seeing at all the fests, lol.

Glad to meet some fellow ledge goers here on the road, lol, but you have to admit the Quarry is a nice fucking swimming hole, lol.

Greenturtle
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: treebeard on January 24, 2013, 04:01 am

Wow,

Ive been going there the last 17 years, ever since I was 10 and I must respectfully disagree with you. The place has changed some but it all depends on how you handle yourself and the crowd you keep.

I admit, in the early 2000's people would walk around yelling, "fungi, fungi", or "I got doses!", it does not really work that way anymore. Nowadays I bring my own drugs with me, and I only give and receive drugs from good friends, and money is never exchanged.

Title: Re: Festivals!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: shakedown street on January 30, 2013, 03:14 pm
Quote from: treebeard on January 28, 2013, 11:01 pm
Quote from: shakedown street on January 24, 2013, 11:02 pm
Don't get me wrong... I had many great times there, just NEVER sell drugs there, Totally not cool.
Drug task force undercover inside and roadblocks outside.

thanks for the tip.

do the roadblocks do random checks of civilians?  DUI stops?
All that^^^^^^^.  There is a drug task force in that county probably because of NLQP and the University. Not much there to worry about besides those two places. They throw up random roadblocks and they would pull you over for a special "dreadlock inspection" better believe that.cops ppatrol around there and pull over anyone who looks suspicious, especially those with out of state plates.
 Mainly if you are going there, DO NOT smoke weed or drink or have any drugs in the passenger compartment. Everything heatsealed and tucked away. Know your rights and don't let the pigs push you around. Dont wear tye dyes and make your hair look as minimally wild as possible. Wear your seatbelt and be sure the car is in good shape and with a licensed driver. Minimize your risk.

Once you get inside watch out for the undercover drug task force fucks. Busted a good buddy once, nuff said...
Do not sell or offer to sell anything to anyone that you dont know WELL. Be discreet where you do transactions should you choose to buy/sell there, narcs will follow you if they think a deal is going down.
   Last thing, I know it's a hippie fest but watch openly doing drugs. Again with the narc thing :'{

NLQP is an awesome venue. I am not attempting to discourage anyone from going there. You will have a great time. An even better time is staying out of jail. KNOW WHO YOU ARE DEALING WITH.

These safety suggestions should take no time out of your weekend and will allow you to sleep in your own bed Sunday night.:}
Enjoy that place, smaller fest venues like that are rapidly disappearing (Anyone remember The Church Of Universal Love and Music in Acme, PA?)
There probably won't be places like that for your kids or grandkids.

and it is a bummer that smaller (dare I use the words alternative or independent?) festivals are disappearing - I sure hope they're not all gone for the next generations.  if they do indeed disappear, I have faith that someone will be touched with the spirit to lead a revival of such important and fun showcases for much of what's great and important in life!  8)

Like there's so much drama in my friends group about festivals right now I'm thinking about just buying 2 tickets for like each fest of the summer and just convincing people to go with me because I don't think they are capable of deciding for themselves. also doing roo, spring awakening (may sound gay but was SOOO dope last year), north coast and whatever else rolls through the area.

Yeah, my main issue right now is finding someone to go to waka with because a lot of my friends will only do one or two fests. Apparently they haven't learned that they can use the barter system at festivals to pay for their tickets...

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: HEATFan on February 27, 2013, 03:58 am
Quote from: goodvibez on February 27, 2013, 03:15 am
Quote from: slysamuel0109 on February 27, 2013, 02:53 am
Quote from: HEATFan on February 27, 2013, 01:41 am
Quote from: goodvibez on February 27, 2013, 01:31 am
Anyone been to dayglow? I know its not a festival but it still looks petty badass...

I have. It was gay as fuck. Would not recommend.

Yeah. Sounds about right.
Why do you say this? I was really wanting to go but I'm not so sure anymore, can someone please explain? Thank you!

Here is why in order from gayest reason to least gay.

1. It was indoors and the floor was vinyl or some shit, like a basketball court. That floor + paint = impossible to dance, bunch of slippage

2. The music sucked and I love to rave. They just didn't put on a good set.

3. Too much of a frat scene, not my style. I'm more classy than keg-standy.

4. My rolls were mediocre

5. Was disgusting. Shit got all over my car, was impossible to wash off my hair/face, and I looked like I crawled out of a dumpster. I have a picture of myself like this. Its not pretty.

6. Based upon the picture of myself alone: Would not recommend.
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: hellwillbetoasty on February 27, 2013, 04:56 am
Yep ^ he summed up everything I have to say about DayGlo.

Awful scene, shit ton of douchey frat boys crawl that shit and make being there unbearable. Especially if you live in a college town (obviously). I don't go to raves anymore but I used to a decent amount, O can respect some electronic shit for sure, if you actually like raving and the EDM scene in general I wouldn't recommend it

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: This Is Serious Mum on March 06, 2013, 04:12 pm
There used to be a wonderful festival in the hinterland of Byron Bay here in sunny Australia called SuperKinkyFreaky

It was held on New Years Day and was a recovery party for all the wonderful people on that part of the Planet; Young cute wood nymphs,  dreadlocks,  gays, Rainbow Serpent types, mum's and dad's,  old and young hippies.....all dancing in the hot humid weather with the sun high in the sparkling blue sky.

A blanket of peace covered this sweet spot.....

The delicious smells of pot, sweat and incense would make for a heady mix with ecstacy tablets and deep beats. ......

Utterly fucking amazingly

Title: Re: Festivals!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: coffeebeast on March 13, 2013, 02:52 am
at all the festivals ive been to, anyone without a "bag" can pass freely through the gates. anyone with a bag will have the bag searched before they enter. ive never had a problem bringing anything in my pockets.

if you wanna be safe, get some spandex style underwear and put the capsules in a baggy and just crotch them.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: jmoney113 on March 14, 2013, 10:03 pm
Gonna hit up Spring Awakening in Chi-Town this June with a great group of people. First time at a festival. My birthday is right before SA so it should be a memorable week. :)

Thinking I'mma bring some molly and/or mints. Anyone know how security is there?

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: XxWINxX94x23 on March 14, 2013, 11:25 pm
Quote from: jmoney113 on March 14, 2013, 10:03 pm
Gonna hit up Spring Awakening in Chi-Town this June with a great group of people. First time at a festival. My birthday is right before SA so it should be a memorable week. :)

Thinking I'mma bring some molly and/or mints. Anyone know how security is there?

*Almost* non-existant. We were forced to pull all items out of our pockets and bags were checked pretty carelessly. Did receive a subtle pat-down though, honestly just feeling for guns/knives/weapons. Bunch of "security" on the inside wearing red shirts, but they looked like volunteers, to be frank. Didn't catch too many undercovers/actual police or anything of that nature, of course I was fucked up most of the day  ;)

I wouldn't be too worried unless your trying to sneak in 100's of rolls. We bought some decent ones off a guy last year. This festival is odd though, because there is no age requirement, so alot of under 17 people were there. Not sure if that was a good thing or not?

SA is awesome, I'll hopefully be there in June!

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: 4am on March 24, 2013, 08:03 pm
I jumped on the bandwagon and bought an EDC Chicago ticket but the current lineup just doesn't suit a large speedway 5 stage EDC. The trance is all there and I love good trance music, but there's not enough headliners for an EDC of that magnitude. I at least expected something similar to what EDC Las Vegas would put on for a festival.

So instead I'm going to be at Summer Camp then head to TomorrowWorld in Atlanta for the last weekend of September. THAT should be an amazing EDM festival.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: euler2718 on March 29, 2013, 09:46 pm
Quote from: Panzerknacker on March 25, 2013, 07:03 am
Say what you will about the festival, but I'm much more excited about Camp Bisco knowing I won't have to buy any drugs there. I was really dreading hunting shit down in that scene.

Camp Bisco can be a lot of fun, but try not to buy any drugs there or if you do. Just track down the Bunk Police tent. Last time I went I was camped right next to them and it came in handy when some cheap L came around. I tested it and it was positive for LSD so I bought it right up, great deal. $30/12 tabs
-euler

Post by: Panzerknacker on April 03, 2013, 11:58 pm
Quote from: euler2718 on March 29, 2013, 09:46 pm
Quote from: Panzerknacker on March 25, 2013, 07:03 am
Say what you will about the festival, but I'm much more excited about Camp Bisco knowing I won't have to buy any drugs there. I was really dreading hunting shit down in that scene.

Camp Bisco can be a lot of fun, but try not to buy any drugs there or if you do. Just track down the Bunk Police tent. Last time I went I was camped right next to them and it came in handy when some cheap L came around. I tested it and it was positive for LSD so I bought it right up, great deal. $30/12 tabs
-euler

Awesome tip man. I plan on stocking up well in advance and knowing exactly what it is I'm taking. That is def a great deal though! Any other Bisco advice? What time do you recommend getting there on Wed. night for parking / getting a site? We have two cars (each with passes) we're hoping to park near each other.

I do like asking people where they get their stuff and tell people to ask if the person selling it to them gets it off silk road and if they say no dont buy from them. although its not a sure-fire way to get good stuff it generally works for my friends that arent lucky enough to get their packages on time.

Hey Festivalia,

I've snuck in small amounts before. Lets say a few Js, some pills, tabs, etc. All small things that are easy to hide. My method has been using an M&Ms minitube and putting all the goodies in there and shoving that in my underwear. Worst case scenario I could just say its my dick and I'm hard. Its never come to that, but that would be my plan.

I'd be curious to know the method you use. Care to share?

Cheers.
HEATFan

I used to have a pair of shoes that had a hidden compartment in the tongue that I could stash stuff in as well. Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mr.Charlie on May 17, 2013, 03:45 pm
Wakarusa is soon upon us!!!!!

I'll be bringing a little more than a half oz. of Canna Inc's stuff to work for some traveling funds and to spread some love around.

Can't wait for Tipper, and 3 hours of Muthafuckin' Widespread Panic!!!!

and don't get me started on two sets of STS9!!!!!

The Chompdown Breakfast is one of my favorite parts of Waka, local businesses and other hippies attending donate a bunch of breakfast food and volunteers cook it. It's a big free breakfast with Dirtfoot playing a little acoustic show by the tables, nothing but smiles around that place, people walking around giving out water,beer and bloody marys.
Such a beautiful sight.


God damn I can't wait!

Post by: Festivalia on June 01, 2013, 07:41 am
This might be 'old' news for some, but it was just announced 2 weeks ago, and artists confirmed 1 week ago:

3 nights Furthur featuring a full recreation of their 1970 WorkingMan's Dead Album(Grateful Dead)
1 night String Cheese Incident + 1 night Zach Brown Incident
2 nights Black Crowes
1 night Widespread Panic + 1 night Widespread + John Fogerty covering CCR tunes.

Interlocking sets, and once in a lifetime collaborative performances.

www.interlockenfestival.com

Oh... my fucking... GOD. I'm there.  ;D

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: goodvibez on June 03, 2013, 03:02 am
So I've kinda already asked this before but never really got anywhere with it.... Just would be awesome if anyone could give any advice and good stealth ways to get a good amount of goodies into a festival, thanks for any input!!
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: streetelitist on June 03, 2013, 04:00 am
Quote from: goodvibez on June 03, 2013, 03:02 am
So I've kinda already asked this before but never really got anywhere with it.... Just would be awesome if anyone could give any advice and good stealth ways to get a good amount of goodies into a festival, thanks for any input!!
I have A LOT of experience with this. For males, the easiest way is to put them anywhere in your crotch area. It depends on how hard your festivals search, because most of the ones around me barely pat you down and you walk straight in. HOWEVER, I have been caught before, because they made me spread my legs and they cupped my ballsack and rubbed the shit out of my dick. I almost got hard, and lost about $2G's of product. The security was corrupt & kept it for themselves and didn't report me to the cops and simply kicked me out.
If you want to bring about 100-200 pills in, the best way is to tape a baggy in between the shaft of your penis and the top of your ballsack. Works every time, 99% of the time.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: zxydwx3 on June 03, 2013, 01:01 pm
100th post!

I recommend, in no particular order: Craven, Big Valley or Merritt Mountain. All are country music festivals, but there are tens of thousands of people partying their asses off, so it's a great time. +/- $200 for a ticket, then count on another few hundred for fuel and camping stuff. I always recommend taking 2 good quality generators so you have unlimited power for running a good stereo system so you can have the party at your campsite after the bands stop (around 11PM) and after the beer gardens close (3AM). Good times, and worth the trip to any of them.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: White 0ut on June 04, 2013, 10:23 am
Quote from: HEATFan on June 04, 2013, 10:13 am
How was Waka with all the rain?

Kinda shitty...

A lot of shows got cancelled, you couldn't walk anywhere without getting completely shit on, it rained the first 2 days....

Snoop was super dope,

 I sold a QP of buds we had 1/8'd out individually in under 24hrs... & sold around 300 caps of MDMA, everyone on the mtn was talking about it. (thanks clearance)

It was still waka though and it was still super weird, can't wait for next year.

I got fucked up, danced with bitches, did about every drug in the book thanks to SR and raged face......

It was dope.

Contemplating Bonaroo...

Interlocken in Virginia.

Confirmed Artists:

Furthur(3 nights) - 1 set/night is a recreation of "Working Mans Dead"
String Cheese Incident(2 nights) - 1 as the "Zach Brown Incident"
Widespread Panic(2 nights) - 1 w/ John Fogerty doing CCR tunes.
Black Crowes(2 nights)

Rumored Artists:

Trey Anastasio/Mike Gordon (perhaps as/with Phish)


This is in the Virginia country-side. Definitely worth every penny they ask for tickets....

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: anonman88 on June 05, 2013, 04:18 am

dude, sooooo many! saturday pretty lights with gramatik and some others at pier six pavillion, also saturday, infected mushroom at soundstage. sunday lotus at soundstage and PVD, krewella, crookers, eptic, paper diamond, and others at echostage for mega glow moonrise makeup eddition. the soundstage ticekts are $20 if i recall while the other 2 are above $40. then on the 14th koan sound is playing with some trap people who were on the line up at 930 club. pretty much go on facebook and look at the steez promo page :) also, if your a fan of david starfire, manifest is doing a party saturday night, set to start after the PL party. pm me if you have any questions :)

Yea Waka always been a rain or shine event but this year was ridiculous!!!!

Main reason i went was to see STS9 because iv been trying to for years and i was waiting inline to get on the first night they played and the second night was rained out so i was disappointed!! Plus the entire venue (all 5 stages) was a huge mud pit!!!

But WSP and Umphries got down!!!

I also got rid of about 30g of mdma (thanks dutchtrade!)...And found someone selling supertrips red ? so i got to try those (not bad)!!! But the Mayans i took with me blew my mind!!!
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: hellwillbetoasty on June 06, 2013, 09:20 pm
FUCK summercamp. Never going back. Ever

So many fucking undercovers in the festival and they'll pull you over for any reason on the way there (IE for having an air freshener hanging from your rearview)

The county sheriff was actuallu quoted about two years ago saying "I'll do everything in my power to get this damn festival out of our county" The damn artists should boycott it or some shit until it is moved somewhere else because it is just ridiculous - at most festivals cops are just going for the drug dealers. But at summercamp, they'll arrest you for ANY amount of ANY drug
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mr.Charlie on June 06, 2013, 10:05 pm
Quote from: hellwillbetoasty on June 06, 2013, 09:20 pm
FUCK summercamp. Never going back. Ever

So many fucking undercovers in the festival and they'll pull you over for any reason on the way there (IE for having an air freshener hanging from your rearview)

The county sheriff was actuallu quoted about two years ago saying "I'll do everything in my power to get this damn festival out of our county" The damn artists should boycott it or some shit until it is moved somewhere else because it is just ridiculous - at most festivals cops are just going for the drug dealers. But at summercamp, they'll arrest you for ANY amount of ANY drug

Yeah, i've heard some horror stories about Bummercamp... ANytime i tell my friends about the cops they say so what? But I'm the one who sells drugs, not them, so they don't think to worry about it. For how close I live to Summercamp, I don't think I'll ever go unless I have enough money to attend AND not have to work it.

Wakarusa on the other hand, was fucking amazing this year. Although it quickly became Swamparusa, the music and the people were fuckin' amazing. I had 20g from CANNA INC i brought with me, a lot of em were single rocks that weighed 1 gram, people went crazy for that shit, sold out in an afternoon. Traded some of 3janes LSD for some pins and weed too.
Noticed a lot of 25i there though...


Snoop Lion was badass, I'm so glad he mostly played Snoop Dogg songs, I was a big Snoop fan back in my younger hip hop days, and there was a Swisher tent there handing out free cigarillos, so it was perfect.

Widespread was fucking pure bliss. My face was melted. Zoogma came out and started with the Jurrassic park song, I was so high i couldn't stop laughing it was great. Yo Mama's Big Fat Booty band covered "Oh baby I like it raw" by Old Dirty Bastard too.

Avoid Gnarnia, they force you to have to drive from your cabin to the festi, there is no camping at the festival campgrounds. the cops pull everyone over driving back and forth, and cabins even get raided

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: psychedelicmind on June 11, 2013, 10:00 am
Quote from: sharonneedles on June 11, 2013, 07:01 am
Any European festivalers got any recommendations this year? :)

Body & Soul in Ireland

Nowhere in Spain (this is like a European version of Burning Man)

Dimensions in Croatia (this is one of the best i've been to)

Boomtown Fair in the UK. Haven't been but heard nothing but good about it.

Secret Garden Party in the UK

Ozora in Hungary
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: ytabletrash on June 11, 2013, 05:51 pm
Quote from: goodvibez on June 08, 2013, 02:14 am
This probably isn't the thread to ask it but if anyone has some good advice on vitamins to take throughout a 4 day festival trip on psychedelics and x that would be awesome!! Just so it doesn't feel like my heads going to explode on the 4th day...
For mdma, you want to take 5-htp to help replace your serotonin levels. I take that after every roll.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Jasper800 on June 17, 2013, 02:30 am
I have went to 5 Bonnaroo's including the first two and this year's line-up was by far the best line-up of any festival in the last 40 years. I went to Rothbury (Electric Forest) the first year (I believe,) and the line-up was awful. It had an organized mix of a line-up. For example; that overrated- frat-jam-folkster Dave Matthews with Snoop Doggy Dogg (who couldn't even remember what city he was in.) Also, I had friends who said "you have to see the Drive-by Truckers...oh man!" So I went to see them at that Rothbury, it was the worst show ever. Rothbury's set up is very cool though... would go again if it wasn't so jammy/dub oriented.

What I learned from festivals is to pace yourself. Take it easy the first couple of days...focus on the music/shows. Then hit it hard on a day when there isn't a lot going on (or something really bad ass.) Get Ambien or something to knock you out for a few hours to sleep through the heat and what not...

Next festival on my list... South by Southwest. Sending my band's press kit to them this year... hopefully it works and I can get in free.  ;D
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: bodnostrokulum on June 17, 2013, 06:37 am
I like free teknivals, cant wait for this summer edition.

FREE PARTY IS NOT A CRIME

23
Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Mr.Charlie on June 17, 2013, 02:52 pm
Quote from: Jasper800 on June 17, 2013, 02:30 am
I have went to 5 Bonnaroo's including the first two and this year's line-up was by far the best line-up of any festival in the last 40 years. I went to Rothbury (Electric Forest) the first year (I believe,) and the line-up was awful. It had an organized mix of a line-up. For example; that overrated- frat-jam-folkster Dave Matthews with Snoop Doggy Dogg (who couldn't even remember what city he was in.) Also, I had friends who said "you have to see the Drive-by Truckers...oh man!" So I went to see them at that Rothbury, it was the worst show ever. Rothbury's set up is very cool though... would go again if it wasn't so jammy/dub oriented.

What I learned from festivals is to pace yourself. Take it easy the first couple of days...focus on the music/shows. Then hit it hard on a day when there isn't a lot going on (or something really bad ass.) Get Ambien or something to knock you out for a few hours to sleep through the heat and what not...

Next festival on my list... South by Southwest. Sending my band's press kit to them this year... hopefully it works and I can get in free.  ;D

Bonnaroo is one of the only big music festivals that isn't focused on jam bands and electronic music. Sounds like Hangout fest and Bonnaroo are more your taste.

And not tryin' to be a dick, but why go to a music fest if music isn't your main focus the whole time? Just curious cus festival tickets are expensive. If you don't dig the music, it'd be easier an cheaper to just go on a like a float trip and party or go to a local show.

Title: Re: Festivals!
Post by: Jasper800 on June 17, 2013, 04:32 pm
Quote from: Mr.Charlie on June 17, 2013, 02:52 pm
Quote from: Jasper800 on June 17, 2013, 02:30 am
I have went to 5 Bonnaroo's including the first two and this year's line-up was by far the best line-up of any festival in the last 40 years. I went to Rothbury (Electric Forest) the first year (I believe,) and the line-up was awful. It had an organized mix of a line-up. For example; that overrated- frat-jam-folkster Dave Matthews with Snoop Doggy Dogg (who couldn't even remember what city he was in.) Also, I had friends who said "you have to see the Drive-by Truckers...oh man!" So I went to see them at that Rothbury, it was the worst show ever. Rothbury's set up is very cool though... would go again if it wasn't so jammy/dub oriented.

What I learned from festivals is to pace yourself. Take it easy the first couple of days...focus on the music/shows. Then hit it hard on a day when there isn't a lot going on (or something really bad ass.) Get Ambien or something to knock you out for a few hours to sleep through the heat and what not...

Next festival on my list... South by Southwest. Sending my band's press kit to them this year... hopefully it works and I can get in free.  ;D

Bonnaroo is one of the only big music festivals that isn't focused on jam bands and electronic music. Sounds like Hangout fest and Bonnaroo are more your taste.

And not tryin' to be a dick, but why go to a music fest if music isn't your main focus the whole time? Just curious cus festival tickets are expensive. If you don't dig the music, it'd be easier an cheaper to just go on a like a float trip and party or go to a local show.

I always focus on the music. I don't get real fucked up like a lot of people. I have been to 9 festivals and about 200+ other shows. However, Rothbury was a free ticket and I had no idea who was there until I showed up and got the handout they give... so I did pretty much stay fucked up there. There was really no one I wanted to see. Every Bonnaroo I've went to, I leave the camp at around noon and don't return until about 3-4 (depending on who's playing late-night and what not.) Crashed until around noon once at the movie theatre tent when they were playing Star Wars. People were walking around me in the morning...it was 100 degrees + haha.. There are people who are only at the festivals to score and stumble through the weekend...not I.

SXSW, Bonnaroo, Pitchfork, and Coachella are some of the only festivals that really focus on exciting music, in my opinion.
